I made sure to wash and dry myself thoroughly before wear. That might have helped.

I normally wear a bra size 30C. I ordered a B cup because I assumed it would run large. I actually think I could have gone up a size, because the cups didn't cover my entire breasts. Not sure if it was supposed to. It didn't let anything bulge through my clothes though, so maybe it was okay.

Edit - I've worn this four or five times out on the town now, and it's still sticking strong. Very pleased!

The sweater looks baggy in the picture but IT IS NOT unless you are a small teenager. I like the thickness of the sweater and the pattern is as advertised, but I am 5'6 120lbs and the sleeves are basically three-quarter length. My arms are not abnormally long, it's just that the swear is much smaller in person than it appears in the photo. The length of the body is just like any other sweater but shorter in the front. It does cover my waist but I had expected it to be longer. Overall, I am pleased with this purchase because the sweater was quite inexpensive, but if you're looking for an oversized sweater to wear with leggings, KEEP LOOKING.

This skirt is very pretty and moves nicely. I measured myself 3 times to be sure and I fall under the maximum size. It is a bit snug but Ill hold on to it until I lose more weight. I am 5' and the skirt falls about mid calf on me. The color is not what the picture shows. Its more of a peachy tone but still very pretty. I am over all very happy with this, I just wish the picture was a little closer to the real color.

How it fits:

I'm 5'2. The skirt is a dusty pink chiffon with a length that hits right at the ankle. The slip is a shiny cream colored slip-type-satin which hit's mid-shin (just above tea length) and the slip definitely gives enough coverage that there's no need for another layer.

Waist size 30". No bunching at the waistline. When I put it on and pull the elastic all the way out, it extends about 4-5 inches out at which point it's taught.

Just FYI, the elastic waistband is not tight but it's not quite a medium tension either. At the same time, it's forgiving because of the width of the waistband (which is 1.25 inches wide). So, give or take. You judge based on your wardrobe and what works for you.

I hope all that's helpful. I was nervous about the waist size and the length.

I was very excited to receive this. I bought one for me and two for gifts. My boyfriend and I opened one up together tonight.

The box was very lovely and put together. From first appearances I'd say this was packaged very well. I took the oyster can and necklace cage out. I examined the cage and it was better quality than I expected for the price. Very happy there.

I then proceeded to open the can with the oyster. This was so much fun for me. I then used the provided plastic to open the shell. It was a little tough to start but worked and popped open. I felt around with the little tool and the pearl popped right out.

When I got the pearl out I wiped it off with a soft cloth and noticed it was not shiny. It was very dull and had crust on it. I tried to gently remove the crust but it would not come off. I was disappointed because this pearl is not one I'd ever wear.

I would have rated this all 5 stars if it had a shiny pearl. I do give it 3 stars as it was a fun experience, the packaging was nice and the necklace was better than expected.

I don't expect that all pearls are like mine. I just happened to get a bad one. It looked a lot like other fresh water pearls I've seen, as it was egg shaped (to be expected).

reviewText: I bought this to wear when traditional binders would show around the collar or neckline of a shirt.  Although it fits according to the measurements provided, it's a nightmare to wear.  The binder material is not stretchy at all, which is essential for safe binding.  I only wore it briefly before it became too uncomfortable.  The material resembles heavy athletic material, and doesn't give the way a binder is supposed to.  It does a very mediocre job of flattening my chest, and hurts in the process.  Don't buy this- it could be hazardous to your health.
summary: This is not a safe binder

After reading ALL the reviews and still not knowing if they were too good to be true (given the price, the one size fits all, and the fact they were available on Amazon Prime) I bought two of these since I was already making purchases.  I am 5'4" and 117lbs.

After getting them in the mail and trying them on immediately I LOVED THEM!!! the material is amazing, the inside is extremely soft.

the do fit kind of long, but i love the modest bunching at my ankles.  The waist can be pulled up beyond your belly button if you have my same body stats, but i choose to leave them right below my bellow button and they stay right in their place.

Needless to say I love the product and the pricing and I went back and bought them in three more colors, I total in five: olive, navy blue, white, copper, and dark purple.  They're all true to their color as shown in the pics, the white is slightly see through, but you can only see the very dark tattoo on the side of my hip JUST A LITTLE.

I wear these all day.  Keep my temp at about 66 in the house so these are just perfect under a pair of jeans, then when dash outside for the mail, etc. don't have to add extra.  Keeps this 78 year old great grandmother plenty warm.
summary: Cuddly warm in this cold weather

reviewText: I bought this for my daughter as a gift. It fit well. She travels a lot and this dress can be smashed into a suitcase and pulled out looking great. She says it is comfortable to wear and it moves well because of the ruching along the sides.

I am 5'7 120lbs and the small fit me perfectly. It was very flattering to my figure. The chest area is well padded, so a bra is not required, however because my chest is not very large (I usually wear a 36B) the dress did not look good without one. Someone with a fuller breast would probably not have this problem. Without a bra, the dress basically hid my breasts and looked a little saggy, so the lift a bra provides was necessary for the dress to work on me.

The sleeves are only attached to the band below the breast- I easily held the sleeves in place on my shoulders with some double sided tape on my bra straps. I was also able to easily hide my bra in the back underneath the dress- the dress can be pulled up in the back to cover it and another small piece of double sided tape ensured that the back of the dress would not pull down throughout the night. With a black bra and a black dress it's not so imperative to hide every piece of the bra, but with a different color dress you'd have to be a bit more careful unless your bra color perfectly matched the dress. The sleeves and padded chest area can be adjusted to cover a bra completely, so this is not an issue at all.

I'm not very curvy and the dress managed to accentuate my hips quite nicely. The fabric of the dress is very smooth and comfortable, and it is double layered throughout so a panty line is not visible. This dress in black looks very classy, and I also ordered the dress in blue.
Adore it but (I am 120lbs and 5'7) and it feels like peeling a sweaty shirt off in summer. Runs small

The section without pocket is stiffer and smoother than section with pocket, and the dye is darker in line with the zipper, sort of a shadow. Not glaringly obvious but definitely not invisible. But nobody is actually looking that closely, stay away from Sherlock Holmes and you'll be fine. Pants size + 2 worked for me.
Update: thankfully it dried out after a week. I've worn it every day in the last four months, no issues and no sign of wearing out. Certainly nice to have a little emergency cash on hand. Upgrade to four stars.

reviewText: Nice pliable leather it's a belt for dress, or work. The money compartment zipper is only about two bills long. If you fold your bills right. You can fold a bill in half, and then in thirds the other way which let you put 4 folder bills snugly. Any more bills have to overlap and this tightens the zipper when closing. All in all it seems to have a good zipper and that out weighs any negatives. Just put your 4-100 dollar bills in it and enjoy this belt  I ordered one size larger to be safe, and I had to drill a new hole, because the belt size was true.

Arrived on time. The length of the hidden compartment was short. 25% of the belt length but worked ok. Size runs a little short as mentioned by others so order 2ins longer than normal as I did and that should work. Quality appears good wore it around Brazil for 2weeks w/o problem.
summary: Runs short. Compartment should be longer. Otherwise good product.

reviewText: I wear  38" Levis.  I ordered a 36" belt.  It is 4" to6" smaller than I should have ordered.  It's a pretty good belt and it's worth what I paid for it.  I should have ordered a belt that was 2" to 4" larger than the waist size of my Levis.

The belt appears to be made from thick quality leather and the zipper pouch works as advertised. I really like the way the belt looked and functioned until the prong broke off the frame of the buckle after only FOUR DAYS of wearing it. I am 6'3" tall and weigh 190 pounds so I don't have a big belly hanging over putting undue stress on the belt. I wear a belt every day and have never broken a belt or buckle. It must have had a flaw in the metal where the prong attached to the frame. On the bright side, the belt comes with snaps to attach the buckle. Since I really like the belt, I will keep it and put another buckle on it. I would have given it five stars if the buckle hadn't broken.
Great Belt!!!

reviewText: good quality leather, very nicely made but too thick, not pliable enough and the zipper failed the very first time I put it to use.

The belt I received was correctly sized - sIze 32 fit my 31 in. waist, although on the second-to-end hole. But the quality of the leather was miserable. The belt was splotchy, with dark, worn-looking spots all over the finish. It looked like a consrtuction worker had worn this belt on the job for about five years before they sent it to me. Atitlan obviously has NO quality control on their merchandize. This appeared to be made of badly-used leather, not a new belt. I am returning it for a refund and will not buy from this company again.

reviewText: Was very pleased. ordered 42 for a 38 inch waist. Perfect. Very nice looking belt.

This is a perfect belt. It has a zipper for hiding bills. Emergency money while traveling always gives me some peace of mind. If folded lengthwise in three, you can easily fit 15 bills. So, conceivably you could hide $1,500 in the belt. If you are traveling, $1,500 goes a long ways in an emergency. So, in case somebody stills your wallet, at least you will have some cash with you.
The belt itself is made by hand and the finish is not that great but not sufficiently shabby to reduce the rating. The hardware is very nice.

We like lightweight cotton jammies for our son, but the ones we've found in local stores are too tight everywhere - he sort of looks like a sausage in a casing.  These fit more or less to size (12-18 mo for our 12 mo son, although I expect we will have to size up before 18 mo) with much more room for his wide chest.  They are wider in the arms and legs as well.  Another customer mentioned short arms and legs - as you can see in the attached picture, they are really the same length as other jammies, just looser.  If your child is very long and lean, this might not be the best fit for them.

(For fire safety, pajamas should be "tight fitting," meaning that there are no loose cuffs at the wrist or ankles that could get into an open flame.  Think of those old-style button down pajamas that were made with non-stretch cotton - those aren't good.  Anything that is made from stretchy material and fits close to the body would meet this safety requirement.  There is no reason you should have to pour your child into their nightclothes.)

From left to right, Carter's size 12 mo, Leveret size 12-18mo, Osh-Kosh size 18mo, Leveret size 18-24mo

reviewText: perfect size for me , the previous one , which I lost , was just a little to tight on the ear but this one works great

Pros:
It's easy to put on and take off.
Looks great on the ear (nice and bright).

Cons:
It might be because the earrings are 14k gold, but they are extremely malleable and fragile. First time taking them off, I accidentally bent part of the earring and had to bend it back into shape, so the earrings would close properly.

The clasp/locking mechanism that keeps the earrings closed seems pretty weak. I'm scared that if someone was to brush my ear or if it was really windy, the earring might fly off my ear without me knowing..

Overall:
I've only received this earrings for a day, and will be planning on wearing them tomorrow for the whole day. So I will see then if the locking mechanism is stable enough to endure the tumbles of daily life.

UPDATE:
After wearing the earrings for one day, one of them broke in half...
Thought this would happen given how thin the earrings were. Kind of sad that this happened.

reviewText: Great everyday bag!!

Let me first say I love this bag, I really do. The size is fantastic. You can put a ton of things inside of this bag. I used it as a purse with the handles only. The look of this bag is very nice with a fade slighlty worn appearance to the faux leather. Mine was in the Coffee color. Unfortunatly the bag did not live up to my expectations in terms of quality. First one of the straps came apart where the metal ring goes through the loop. The loop came away from the bag. I was able to stitch the flap back on to the bag. This is how much I loved this bag, that I was willing to fix it myself. Next to fall apart was the lining along the handles. The thin rubber accent started to peel off. This was all within a six month period of time.

Now, I carry heavy things in my purse (books, small laptop etc) so I know that that was definitely a contributor to the issue with the metal ring flap detaching. Even knowing that I still love this bag and I still use it, albeit on the weekends instead of as a work bag. I would buy it again and would recommend anyone else to buy it as long as you are not using it for heavy items.
summary: Perfect Sized Tote for a Great Price

Update:
Six months later and about half a bottle of febreeze later, this still smells horrible. Like rotted garbage and putrid fish.  Every time I open it or get close to the inside of it, I get a huge whiff of pure stink.  I guess it is the chemicals used to dye it.  This is a shame because the purse itself is nice and I would really like to love it.  It looks nice, is roomy, has good pockets, but the odor is just too overwhelming.  Such a shame.

The two little open pockets in the main compartment are perfect for holding my phone and keys, and the zippered pocket on the other side holds a handful of tampons and a tube of lipstick with room to spare. There's another little zippered pocket on the back that I use for carrying a small notepad and a handful of crayons for my son.
I do wish that it had more pockets, but I wish pretty much everything had more pockets.
It's gotten a little bit saggy over the months, but it's not a structured bag, so that's to be expected. It's actually less saggy than I would have expected.
I would definitely buy from this brand again.

reviewText:
Can not beat the price- the fittings and metal pieces are quality and are sewn in well to design.  Have not seen this kind of quality at this price in years. Bit awkward at first, but it is breaking me into its usefulness as the days wear on. reviewText: I gave this as a gift to my girlfriend. She loves it.

The Good:
-I love the color (I have the coffee color - a nice deep brown) and style of this bag; the straps are a good size to fit over my shoulder, and I like having the option of a cross body strap as well (the strap can detach).  It looks like a higher end bag without the hefty price.
-It's a nice size; I can fit what I need plus some.  It also has a few inside pockets which are fairly deep (can hold some pens, chapstick, small pack of kleenex) and an inner zipped pocket.
-I like having the outer zip pocket; is just the right size to store my phone for quick access (iPhone 6)

The Bad:
-THE SMELL.  I have tried and tried to get rid of the "fishy" smell, but it still has an odor.  I've tried wiping and spraying with vinegar, spraying with perfume, dryer sheets, etc. but the smell is still there.  It's not as potent as when I first received it, but it still has an odor after all my efforts, and if I put things like my fabric lined wallet, makeup bag, etc. inside, they take on that same smell.  I'm not sure how to permanently get rid of the smell - if it didn't smell so bad I'd bump my review up to 5 stars, because I like all other aspects of this bag.

reviewText: I love this bag. It is big enough to fit papers and a notebook or two for work along with my lunch, gloves, wallet, etc. but still feels like a purse. The material is perfect because it doesn't look plasticky but won't get destroyed like leather. I do wish it had another pocket or two. Inside there is only one small zipper pocket. When mine arrived I was a little skeptical about the clasp on the shoulder strap. Sure enough, it broke less than five minutes into my walking commute. Thankfully, I contacted the seller and received a replacement strap. The clasp is a little different and has been great so far.
summary: Great once the shoulder strap was replaced

reviewText: The quality of the bag was great and the leather looked genuine. After a month or so of use, however, one of the rings attaching the handle to the bag broke, rendering it useless. I was sad to have to send it back!

So I've had this purse for a few days now.

My initial reaction was that it was way too big, but in perspective I was going from a very small cross-body to a full size purse(that I have carried for years). So now after having it for a few days I still think it is large on me; but I'm 5'1" and 100lb so everything is large on me, it is exactly what I needed to carry my things around campus. It is large enough to carry one or two note books or a small laptop, which mine is not so mine won't fit. It is a wonderful "movie purse". It will fit everything you need plus more and not looked over stuffed.

The only thing I do not like is the pockets. There is one zipper pocket on the inside and for such a large purse it is very small. There are two pockets on the inside but they are useless because they are only 2-3 inches deep and nothing, not even my chapstick will stay in them. And lastly there is one zipper pocket on the out side, and it two is rather small for such a large purse and it kind of in an awkward spot thats hard to get to unless you set the purse down. I have yet to find a purpose for the zipper pocket on the outside.

So if you are looking for a good size tote then this will work for you but if you have to have functional pockets them I recommend looking for a different purse.
I love this handbag.  For me, it's just the right size.  I don't have to use the additional strap because the regular straps are long enough to use as a shoulder bag.

This bag holds my 13" Macbook Air perfectly, as well as having enough pockets to hold everything. I normally have a notebook, pencil bag, large wallet, and mini umbrella in it as well. It's pretty cheap considering how well made it seems to be. I've only been using it about a week, but I have no complaints so far. I bought it because I needed something that worked for work and school, both, and this fits the bill! It also makes me carry less because it is relatively slim, which I enjoy..

Not exactly Slave Leia, but the quality is good enough for the price. The reviews I read for any more authentic Slave Leia costume in this price range were not kind, so I stumbled upon this. I gave it a go and was not disappointed (again, for the price). The bottoms are top notch, very sexy and could easily fit the sizes indicated. The little tinkling coins are a nice touch, and they even sent extra in case some fall off and get lost.

The bra on top though, maybe built for an A-cup at best. If you're bustier than that, just know there's not much support. It wasn't terrible and it can work, but I think anyone in a very large range may want to look at a different costume. I'm planning to try one of those adhesive sticky bras underneath and see if that helps. Don't get me wrong though, it's still very sexy without.

The neck piece and chain are of decent quality and fit comfortably. Overall I'm pretty satisfied with this set.

The hubby loves it on me, it was a real gift and surprise after wearing it for him.. thanks Amazon and Dreamgirl International. All the good reviews about this product is accurate.

Being 5'2 and 155lbs I ordered a large and with a great pair of spanx rocked it. The material is stretchy  cotton and the bird/feather design hides unwanted flaws. This dress may not be for everyone. Know your body type(mine is hourglass). I got compliments all night long and continue to get compliments from pics posted on social media accounts. Great buy I plan to order a few more.

This dress took a little while but it was worth the wait. I am a large girl US size 14-16 5'-10' and I took the chance on this dress because I could tell the fabric  stretches very well. If you are larger than this, do not take that chance or the fabric will stretch too much and make the colors look washed out. The colors are vibrant and interesting. I will buy other styles in this dress.

This is definitely a "LOOK AT ME" kind of dress.  I'll likely only wear it while on vacation, as it's too loud for my conservative style at the office.  I might be able to tone it down with a jacket, but it's absolutely fabulous.  I'm usually a brown tone kind of person, so if you normally wear these bright flashy colors, you'll LOVE this dress.  The size was a bit small, if you have any kind of love handle, you'll want to wear a minimizer underneath to help smooth out those imperfections.  The length goes to the knee or just below.  I'm 5'6"  and weigh 130lbs, and it lays barely below my knee.  After I sit and stand up, it would probably be right at my knee.  This is a very form fitting dress. Adding a thick belt to it would also disguise any ripples at the waist.  I ordered a US 8/10 and it fits more like a US 6/8 size.  The material is very stretchy.  My daughter loves it, so after vacation I'll pass it on to her.

Great layering tank. Length is as shown in the picture (if you are approx. 5"8). Good quality, straps seem to endure the washing machine cycle on delicate (I lay mine flat to dry and skip the dryer). I have ordered this same tank in three other colors!

It can also be worn in a "gathered" way if you want the length to be shorter too. The color was great (black is BLACK). Straps are easily adjustable. No built in bra which is awesome. Only reason I kept the tank is because it was so cheap it wasn't worth returning it.

I normally choose a size 1 for everything. I'm petite, 5'4 around 115lbs and I have a shapely body. Size 1 is my size but when I see skinny jeans it's that war of "I have to try it on first" but I don't do returns. So I ordered a size 3. It fits my curvy bottom and my thighs just fine but it's very baggy in the knees on down just a little bit and I'm short (petite really) so some hemming is needed. I recommend the size up if you're curvy and not a stick with toothpicks. We're not all bones and having healthy figures is fine it's trying to find pants that fit that's the hard part. These are great pants, comfy, and a bit stretchy so if you're willing to risk the reliability of how stretchy it is then go right ahead.
summary: Try to guess your size accordingly

I was looking for a T-shirt to wear under business shirts that fit my body type. I am 6'3" and 180lbs, lean. Nothing that I tried ever fit me across the typical brands that you find in stores.

I finally found a thin enough cotton shirt that is narrow enough to avoid lumps of material under the business attire, but long enough to stay tucked in on a longer torso.

According to the recommendation I should've picked a large, but upon reading the reviews I went with a medium. No regrets!
----

I'm 6'2, athletic build and have a  long torso.  With undershirts I always buy large, normally xl in regular shirts, and this fits as a undershirt should. After washing and drying the shirts, they were still long enough to tuck in and fit snug to my body. Obviously your build will determine what style of shirt you buy, but undershirts should fit snug. They should not cause your dress shirt to be frumpy at the waist, you shouldn't be able to tell that they are there. Also, the v was nice and deep so if I don't feel like wearing a tie, I can unbutton the top and not worry about the collar showing. I highly recommend these shirts.

Pros: Truly slim-fitting in the midsection without being restrictive in the upper body. Sleeves are nice and short to prevent showing underneath tees. Soft, supple, and lightweight.

Con: shrinkage. 2xist should make them longer by a good 2 inches  to accommodate shrinking. If you use a dryer, DO NOT dry with high heat.

Got my adorable hoodie today--I love it! It's comfy and cozy. I went by other reviews on sizing. The best thing to do is to check the listed measurements, but also this particular seller has US sizing equivalents next to the DAUNTING many x's sizes. Ignore those x's and go by what their equivalent US sizes and measurements are. I NORMALLY wear a size XL/14. I ordered 3XL (XXXL): US 14 (their equivalent), and it fits great. I'm 5'6" tall, my bust-waist-hip measurements are 43-34-42, and this fits nicely. The bottom portion is nice and stretchy, and I really like that it is longer, as well as the sleeves. The hood is thicker than the body and sleeves, but I personally like that because I don't like to get too hot. It is still nice, soft, and warm.

Many reviewers also didn't like how this hoodie looked unzipped because of the double zipper, but I think it looks fine and it doesn't look weird or bad at all. I'm very happy with this purchase, and I will be getting another for my mom. If the manufacturers ever offer this in brown, I'll be all over that, too!!

Update 1/3/15:

I purchased another hoodie for my mom, and she LOVES it! I've had my hoodie for a couple of months, and I still love it. I'm so satisfied with this purchase!

I fell in love with the look of this watch. When it arrived I was not disappointed, actually the heavy solid feel and the very nice watch band exceeded my expectations. OK so why the three stars...this is a great feeling, unique looking watch and definitely more of a quality look then many watches in this price range. Within a few days the larger of the two watch faces ceased working (battery???) the compass and the temperature gage are really more decoration then to be used in fact. So the big thing was the main watch face going so quickly. I can still tell the time with the small face but its kind of a nuisance.  Buy it for the fun comments you'll undoubtably receive but as a watch it falls a little short.

This necklace compliments so many outfits.  It has an adjustable clasp so it can be fitted tighter or looser around the neck.  The black "string" is like fishing wire (plastic).  There are a few different bead types to allow contrast.  The weight is not too heavy so I was able to wear all day without any issue (I've had bibs in the past where the beads felt like they were pulling down my neck).  Overall, I love the necklace and will purchase different colors, as it can be worn under your shirt (where some of the top layers fall out on top of the shirt which allows the necklace to look like a shorter bib) or if your have a low neckline shirt, this can be worn with a dramatic effect.  Love it!
summary: Can't beat it for the price and wow factor

I returned these gloves. The claim was that the gloves were waterproof. I ran the pointer finger under water, put my finger in the glove and my finger was wet. I emailed the sender to ask for information regarding a return policy and the vendor failed to respond. I then emailed Amazon directly and was told my money would be refunded when I returned the gloves. I returned the gloves on December 24th but at of yet, my account has not been credited.
My son in-law uses these gloves for his daily motorcycle commute in the Northwest. They do the job for temps down to the low 40's. Well worth the cost.

I heard others complain of an odor, but I did not experience that. First time ordering from this retailer and was unsure what to expect. I am 5'4" and 130lbs. I normally wear a size 6/8 in Misses and a size 9 in Juniors, size medium in Juniors tops and size small in Misses tops. I ordered a medium in this shirt because I was afraid it would be too small. The medium is a tad bit too big, especially in the shoulders, which have a little puff to them. I would have absolutely LOVED this shirt if it was the correct size. So if you are unsure whether to go with a small or medium, size down. I will not return because I don't want to wait for another product or deal with a return, but I will be washing and drying item to see if it shrinks the fabric a bit. Nice material, and the lace is exactly as pictured. Has a nice length to the hem, hits about hipbone area on me, but the sleeves are a tad bit long. Again, hoping it will shrink a little in the dryer and fit perfectly.  Good for the price, but if it doesn't shrink in the wash, I will be giving it to my friend who would fit in it perfectly. Oh, and the neck is a sheer lace. I was under the impression it was fabric with lace overlay. No problem, but different than I thought. Nice stitching as well.

The problem with Allegra is that it's 50/50. I have ordered at least six or eight of their tops. In general, they do not look much like the pictures in person. The sizing certainly isn't uniform at all, which is my second-biggest gripe. This particular top is boxy and the sleees don't look like the picture at all! There is no cuff. I didn't expect silk, but the material is pretty cheap-looking. I wear a size 4/6 at 5'10" and 36B. I ordered a medium in this one, and I'm swamped. It has no shape and hangs around the neck. This one is a toss. Like I said, 50/50 at best. I keep getting lured in by the pictures, but be warned, you won't be getting what you see. Colors, details, fabrics. fit - all are different, not only within blouses in general, but even when you do like it and it just doesn't fit, if you order a different size, it doesn't fit either. I give up on Allegra!!

It's Hilarious it really is, but there is a severe possibility of suffocation. It's a small mask if you ask me. I have an average sized head 23.5 in around. My head barely fit in the thing. I played a prank visiting my friends in VA. They leave there dorm unlocked so I snuck in before they knew I had come down. Long story short I burst out of a chip coverd bathroom and hightailed it out the back door with the mask on. (which is really hard to see out of while running cause the eye holes slip upward) My loose cannon friend caught me on my way back and had me in a sleeper hold thinking i was a burglar (yes i get it i deserved that). but im just trying to tell you I nearly suffocated to death until another guy pulled the mask off. All in all it was worth (smirnoff) Icing the kid who choked me. Later i cut a line below the beak and duck taped it up to give me more breathing room. unless you really need the pigeon one id go with a different one. Seriously I was scared to wear it after that.
summary: Great product, except for the suffocation hazard

reviewText: This mask has changed my life completely. Ever since I bought this, I got off drugs, alcohol, and i brought my grades up. I don't think I would still be alive if it weren't for this mask. I was contemplating suicide, I didn't want to live anymore because I had nothing to live for. It gave me the hope and the strength I needed to push on. So far, I've donated to over 2 charities from the donations given to me fro wearing this mask. It is, and always will be my best friend.
summary: This is the best thing in my life.

reviewText:
CONS:
-  The fit was almost too tight.
-  It was a little on the "thin" side as far as material goes.
-  The product picture incorrectly defines how "short" this mask really is. Your neck WILL show.

PROS:
-  This mask will scare the BEJEEBUS out of <insert house pet here>. It is truly creepy and allows for accessories. Like hats.
- IT DOESNT SMELL! That is beyond a pro when it comes to masks. Most of them smell like they're made of rubber and cat turds, but this latex does NOT smell chemicalized at all.
- Pretty clear viewing. No problems adjusting the mask to the eyes.

TL;DR -  Mask scary. Mask no stinky. Mask little cheap.

Some of the reviews say that it's cheap and too small, which was the first thing I checked about it when I got it. However just for scope, I'm a woman with a 22" diameter head, and the mask covers my whole head and neck, with little to no asphyxiation risk. If you do have a much bigger head and longer neck, you may have issues, so keep that in mind if you want to buy it; even have someone with you when you try it on incase you need help (I didn't need any). All I needed was a silly looking pigeon mask for as cheap as I can get it for a costume to wear to an anime convention, and it's exactly what I need. Also I'd say it's made just fine, and sturdy enough for well, whatever one might do with a pigeon mask. My only complaint is the eye holes aren't placed very well. I might try to cut them out to see better because I'm not going to have a handler when I wear it.

In the end, I'd recommend it. If you buy this, have fun with any and all pigeon-related shenanigans!
summary: A perfectly fine, inexpensive latex pigeon head

reviewText: I just got this wig in the mail and I'm so disappointed. It's super thin on top which makes it very difficult to hide the seams. The wig was absolutely marvelous! I only wore it out once for about twelve hours. The color is just as vibrantly pictured. Some preliminary shedding. As I don't usually wear wigs, I thought this one was great. After a sweaty night of dancing, it was very tangled the next day. I think I brushed out more hair than I left in, and it's a think, durable piece of work. It was a one time use for me, but anyone planning on using it longer should mind the tedious care.

I ordered this in size large but it was way too big.  The medium was just right and I couldn't be more happy. I have an insulin pump and it's a struggle to find a place to put in when wearing a cute summer dress. This eliminates that problem and I am so excited! It is very sturdy and isn't going to fall off. Love it!

As a person that frequently wears skirts and dresses but doesn't carry a purse I was looking for a convenient way to carry a few items when I go out.  I was pleasantly surprised at how much this product will hold and stay put.  I loaded it up with an iphone5, car key, chapstick, credit card and some cash.  It easily and securely held all of the items.  As mentioned in other reviews, you should be mindful of size.  I am a pretty standard pants size 4-6 so I ordered the small.  It fits comfortably on the lower thigh but was a bit tight when I moved it higher up the leg so it didn't show.  I put it on empty and wore it around the house for a few hours and found that it did stretch a bit and became more comfortable without losing its grip or sliding down the leg.  I ordered the nude because I wasn't intending for it to show.  If it were to slip beneath the hem of my dress I think it would appear that I was wearing a girdle.  If I order another, I'll get another color and be less concerned if it were to show.  Overall though, the product does exactly what I hoped it would.

I had low expectations for this item and I'm very impressed.  The velcro will hold, sturdy, discreet.  It's a bit pricey, but the quality makes me believe it will hold up.  The convenience of not stuffing my bra is worth the price.

it stretches a little but over all a good product especially at events and outings in the summer. it does nor work as well over leggings but still works as a good place to put your stuff. does not fully fit an iPhone  but everything else fits really nice and the phone does fit  and won't fall out even if it docent fit in the inner pockets.

This product is fantastic. It solves the biggest #firstworldproblem I incur where to put all my stuff when dancing and wearing a dress! I ordered the smallest one and I'm petite, only about 5'2" and 120ish pounds, but it barely wrapped around my leg, so I would suggest going up a size as I'm pretty sure my thigh isn't considered huge. Part of the problem may be that under a mini length dress, it needs to go up really high on the thigh or it would show. Reaching up my dress to access my credit card and ID is a little awkward, but it's definitely way better than carrying a bunch of junk around in my hands, stuffed in my bra, or constantly losing track of my purse and being worried about sticky fingers getting into my bag. I definitely recommend this product and all of my friends were totally wowed by it as well. The velcro is strong and the grip was pretty decent. I did find that it started slipping down towards the end of the night, but it just took a trip to the bathroom to put it back on a little tighter.

I was happy with it at first. It's made well, with a strong velcro closure and thick lace. It has multiple pockets and a grippy material on the inside. Visibly, it's perfect. Unfortunately it ended up in the bottom of my purse every single time I tried to use it. First off, no matter how tightly I fixed it to my thigh, it found a way to slide down my leg, even when I was only walking. Secondly, most of my summer dresses were not long enough to cover the whole thing, and I am not talking about skimpy dresses either. The idea of the product is great and I really wish it worked better but I don't think this was worth the purchase.
Being rubberized it was sweaty and felt uncomfortable.

I unfortunately didn't try this out until after my return period had ended. I wear a small and fit into jeans 4-6 so I bought a small. It only fits 2 inches above the knee. It can't go any higher. I also figured this would be really effortless to wear but instead it's bulky enough (without stuff inside it) and my thighs do touch enough that I can feel it rubbing my other thigh when I walk. In any dress that doesn't have a flared skirt you can see it right through the fabric very obviously. The black lace is pretty but I thought the pockets would all be within the beige fabric behind it. Instead only one pocket is like that - for the others you can see the contents behind the lace and in front of the beige fabric. In my experience wearing it for 20 minutes before I left the house it sagged and didn't seem to hold up on any place on my thigh. And for the price....well I wish I had figured this out in time to send it back. I ended up buying a small crossbody for going out - more effective.
I ordered this for a trip to Europe but ended up returning it, it was a great idea but didn't fit enough to be worth the hassle of wearing something I would be worried might stretch out and fall off.
summary: it was a great idea but didn't fit enough to be worth the ...

reviewText: purchased for a specific event for fun, worked well and have used several times.  Really convenient when you don't want to carry a purse
summary: purchased for a specific event for fun, worked well and have used several times

reviewText: Excellent product! What a great idea AND it's executed magnificently. A word of caution regarding sizing; if you're on the fence (between sizes) order the smaller size! I'm a pant size 13/14 and ordered a Large but it is way too big! The garter dropped right down my leg as I walked around and the only items I "packed" were my ID and some cash.
Perfect for a night out! Looks great!!
this item is awesome - and exactly what i had hoped it would be!  now i can carry those tiny cocktail purses, and all my other stuff :)
summary: this item is awesome - and exactly what i had hoped it would ...

reviewText: Amazing! Makes it possible to have your phone on you and still be able to dance around.
summary: Perfect for when a purse just won't do.

reviewText: i love that the garter has been repurposed to be both sexy and functional. My iPhone fits well in it (I don't have a protective case on it to give it bulk). I haven't tried wearing it while biking around the city yet and would probably be cautious of that but for ordinary use - this works well.
Perfect for my insulin pump.

I read a girl who posted that the sizing was very small. She was a size 6 and needed a large. Either she or I have grossly unrealistic understanding of our bodies. I'm an 8 and bought the Xlarge, as I'm a curvy woman, it was HUGE. I think I could have gotten away with a medium, large could have been okay I suspect. I ended up sewing it smaller since there wasn't time to return it. It worked very well, didn't slide around and stayed in place. My only complaint would be where the velcro part it, it causes a bump in the fabric if you have anything tight. It's not very inconspicuous.
So great! I use this to hold my insulin pump. Much better than any other type of thigh thing I've tried.
summary: So great! I use this to hold my insulin pump

reviewText: I really want to love this item.  The concept is great, it's sexy, and holds a reasonable amount of stuff.  My main issue with it is accessing my belongings in the pockets.  They are very challenging to get in and out of.  there is a hidden flap inside the top of each pocket where the 2 layers of lining meet underneath the lace.  It's hard to describe if you aren't holding it in front of you.  Essentially, when I tried to dig out my money, ID, or anything, I found myself awkwardly fumbling all bent over digging into this garter unsuccessfully.  My hand kept ending up between the lace and the lining, rather than between the 2 layers of lining, which is the pocket.  I eventually got tired of hunching over and digging around my thigh, (because I looked so ridiculous) so I just gave up and took it off to get my money out of it at the bar.  Yeah, not so sexy or smooth.  I'm guessing that the pockets are designed this way to prevent things from falling out, but it also makes it nearly impossible to access while it's on your thigh.  That being said, I still am thrilled with the idea of not having to carry a purse, so I'm keeping it in hopes that I'll eventually get used to the adult proof pocket design.
summary: I really want to love this item

reviewText: Love it!
Just a little big, but it will be OK for the times I wear a dress to hold my insulin pump
Love it. Bought for insulin pump.

I looked into several sources for a Womens Garter Wallet and didn't want to spend too much $ on it.

Pictures of other brands were not encouraging, kind of cheap looking...

This brand rocks! Seriously, great quality. It fits securely and looks really sexy and fun. I used it for a flask, but there is space and additional pockets within the garter to add other items.

I would absolutely spend the money to purchase multiple as gifts for girlfriends or a bachelorette party. Really, a great purchase!

As far as size, it do not think it runs small but I am a small person...I think I would order a size up if you are a 4US+ or have especially muscular thighs, I would recommend purchasing on the bigger size because you can adjust it tighter.
summary: It fits securely and looks really sexy and fun

reviewText: I'm planning a solo trip through some European cities known for pickpockets and was concerned about where to keep important things like my passport - tried a few other things, but all were obvious that I was hiding something.  I haven't road tested this yet, but I've been wearing it around the house and it's great.  Sexy yet discreet - doesn't slip no matter what I'm doing - this may be the best travel investment I've ever made!
Great product idea. Use for insulin pump. Wish rubber worked a bit better as sometimes it slups down but overall, ok.
love it...great insulin pump accessory

I love this.  I wear an insulin pump and sensor and this is a GREAT way of wearing it when I have on a dress or skirt for work, rather than putting on a belt click or wearing in my bra.  I have been using them for several months, they stay up, no sliding down, but I do think they run a size small, I have thin legs and bought the small, thinking I should have gone with the medium.
summary: I love this. I wear an insulin pump and sensor ...

reviewText: Got the wrong size. Slipped off my leg.
summary: Passing it on to a friend.

reviewText: I am so excited to get this.  Was eyeing it for a while.  Never have pockets.  Always wear skirts and hate carrying a purse.  I can't wait to go out and use this.  May change my rating after first use, but totally seems well made and looks like it will do what I bought it for.
My Grandaughter uses it for her diabetic pump
Very handy
I feel like I could be more firm but even having a bit of flab on my legs this doesn't create "rolls" or change the natural shape of your leg to be noticed. I love this
BOUGHT WRONG SIZE. STILL A NICE PRODUCT. RUNS BIG.
summary: STILL A NICE PRODUCT. RUNS BIG

reviewText: This worked well for my honeymoon overseas. It held my iPhone 5c, passport, and a wad of cash rather well. I didn't have any trouble with it sliding down, although it did chafe pretty badly after wearing it walking around all day. It also left red imprints on my skin. However, I imagine that I will not have these problems if I only wore it for an evening and didn't have a heavy phone in it.
summary: although it did chafe pretty badly after wearing it walking around all day

reviewText: Great for a night at the club when you don't want to carry around a wallet or purse.
I love this!! I wear it quite a bit and it always stays in place.
High quality, will be using for travel!
started to slip after walking around with my phone

I don't wear pants and this thing is the closest thing to pockets I've ever had!  I love that I can tuck my cell phone, some cash, and my keys in it and not have to worry about it.  When I first tried it on I loaded it up and jumped up and down about 20 times, nothing moved!  I also use this to keep my FitBit in.  It seems to count my step more accurately than when I clip it to my bra and it's much more discrete.

I received my garter timely and ordered the small as I wear a size 4/6. However it was a bit too snug to fit my belongings. I just sent it back for a medium. Otherwise the garter looks well made and is cute. With a medium I shouldn't have a problem fitting my phone and lipstick. Also I contacted the seller for an exchange and they were very prompt. Hopefully I'll have my new garter soon. Assuming I'll get me garter soon I'll change my rating to 5 stars.
summary: Small too small but awesome garter.

reviewText: I got this as a christmas gifts for my 4 girls and they all loved it!
great product fits great.  Not the answer for every outing; however, it certainly works for crowded rooms where a purse is not the answer!

I got this specifically for my Halloween costume: I was wearing a dress and didn't have pockets for my phone, and wasn't going to carry around a purse all night. I kept my phone and some makeup in this garter and it stayed put all night, even through dancing.
I'm very impressed, and highly recommend it.

Note that you cannot wear it with leggings, it only works on bare skin.
Sizing: I wear a size 10 pant and have a little larger thighs than usual, and the medium was comfortably snug. The large was too large.

It stayed in place when I first tried it on and walked and sat. It fell down when I ran and squated. So I guess depending on your expected activity it could work for you. I don't want to use it for touring the city, may have to run to catch the subway.
Great fit with all the right pockets to carry your stuff. There's no sexier way to answer your phone than to lift your skirt slightly and retrieve it from your girly go garter. :-)
summary: Sexy way to carry your stuff.

reviewText: Love this garter belt. Haven't used it going out yet but it fits perfect and has a ton of slots to hide stuff!
Very practical and with room for passports, money and other stuff.  Soon to be tested on a European trip, but my wife really likes the design and security of this product.
summary: Very practical and with room for passports, money and ...

reviewText: I use this for my insulin pump. The pump fits easily into the pockets and stays put. Love wearing it with dresses!
Can fit all her crap so there's no need for purse to get lost at the prom! Runs a tad small, but figured this and bought one size bigger. Stayed up and didn't look bulky.
summary: Hides stuff well, a little small...

reviewText: It's very pretty however I found the lace to be a little itchy.  It's fits an insulin pump nicely and has a lot of "hold", however I found the garter ran a little large.  I would recommend going down a size from your "normal" size.  The color is more of a light apricot, rather than nude or light beige.  Quality was excellent!

This was awesome for a wedding I just attended! It's very cute and the inner lining has a comfortable rubbery grip that prevents from sliding down - given that it's the right fit for you.

I wish I had ordered a medium instead of a large.  I'm normally a medium so that's my own fault.  The single velcro strip didn't 't leave much room for tightening as I had expected so the alternative was it just slide it higher up my thigh.  Not a major problem in my case.  It was great at holding small items like cash, credit cards, hotel keys, lip gloss and a couple advils. I felt that my iPhone felt a bit too heavy to fit securely in the pockets so I ended up just holding it...still much better than lugging around a purse while on the dance floor!

UPDATE: I found this to be problematic for my insulin pump.  As mentioned earlier, you have to go reach way up under your skirt to to pull whatever it is that you want up and out of the pockets in the garter.  It ended up being too obvious and I could not access my pump discretely.  I am now using bicycle shorts/compression shorts where I can just slip my pump up into the bottom of the short.  Much easier and more discrete.
I bought my first Girly Go Garter in nude from the manufacturer's website back in January for my insulin pump.  I wear it so much that I purchased a hot pink one from Amazon.  The nude one I've worn for months still fits well and has not stretched.  I am a size 4 with big thighs (22" at the top) and the Small fits perfectly.  I can wear it at the top of my leg or midway down if I have a longer skirt.  I only use it for my pump so it's not loaded down but it never slides or moves around and I can totally forget that I have it on.  As some others have said, it can be a bit awkward reaching up your skirt to access your items, but the convenience far outweighs the awkwardness.  I highly recommend it.
Love it! Just what I needed for small items. No need for wristlets.

It's not bad, and I'd give this a 5 had it not lost my iphone. I used it on a night of dancing only to suddenly notice my phone was gone but my keys and card intact. (Thankfully someone turned in my lost phone but) I have doubts about ever using this to hold my phone again.
summary: Kept my cards and keys in...but lost my phone

reviewText: I bought this garter for a trip to Italy, and it worked out better than I expected! When you first get it, it will be a tight fit, but they stretch quickly. I got a small and it barely fit at first, so my mother got a medium and she couldn't use hers as it became too big almost immediately. Mine doesn't slip- I can fit my phone, credit cards, money and change- whatever you want. I will definitely be using it when I go to concerts, etc. or anytime I am wearing a skirt and don't want to carry a purse. You do have to lift up your skirt a bit to get at it, but anyone that caught me doing this commented that it was a cool little secret. You can also wear it low closer to your knee if you're uncomfortable with hiking it way up, of course, which is what I do. All in all a great buy!

Absolutely love this wallet.  I have the same one in brown, and it's fantastic.

I'm a golfer with a long history of backpain, and I've switched to having the wallet in one of my front pockets as a result.  The problem is that having a fat wallet with my keys and cell phone looks ridiculous.  This Bellroy wallet keeps me in check, only carrying things that I need, and minimizing the extra material in my pocket.

Pros:
-VERY thin
-High quality leather
-Secure, as it's a closed wallet.

Cons:
-Zipper that keeps it secure is still a zipper, uncommon... and you get the "really?" look every once in a while.
-Little expensive.

Overall, worth the price, worth the effort.  If you think this is too small, they also have other BIGGER wallets available.  Next on my list is the travel wallet, which holds passports.
summary: My favorite everyday (non travel) wallet ever.

reviewText: I've had this for a week so far. It's exactly what I was looking for as I tried to slim down my wallet. Heck, it even forced me to re-evaluate the amount of junk I carried. The only drawback is that if you're not careful, it's easy for a credit card or two to slip out accidentally depending on how you hold the wallet, unzipped, during a transaction. As an added bonus, this wallet was in my jersey pocket as I cycled in the rain but no damage at all to the outer layer. I highly recommend for those looking to simplify.
the zipper is a little tight, but that probably helps is protect the contents...very nicely made.  The leather is also nice.
I have been looking for this kind of wallet solution for a while and this one hits the target!!!!  Well made, perfect size and keeps my money, license and cards secure!!!!
Not cheap.  Extremely high quality.  Perfect for carrying a light wallet for cash/credit card/license when (1) road biking, (2) ski and snowboard, and (3) jogging.
summary: Perfect for minimalist cash/credit carry when doing sports...

reviewText:
Very nice ,small and super light .
It`s can hold more than 9 cards with money easily.

     
   9        
  25              
 
    60      
     82
summary: Very nice, small and super light

reviewText: I love it! I moved from the hide and seek wallet from bellroy. For some reason my cards would get cracked from the old design... So I had to change it out. The new hide and seek looks to have walked that problem and add storage. For me in attempting to minimalize my habits. So far I love it! Most of the time I think I don't have a wallet.

While I loved the unique color of this little wallet and the small size was just what I was looking for, the quality of the leather was quite poor. Very thin, flimsy&cheap. The zipper also was not great. Didn't zip smoothly at all and pull tap on zipper was much bigger than necessary, for such a compact wallet. Tho their packaging was great and delivery was speedy. It was not what I was expecting from a 57$ price tag! My return was accepted graciously.
Awesome Wallet
I bought a black one, love it. I prefer a front pocket minimal wallet and this ticks the boxes. Well made, has a nice feel to it.

90+ Days REVIEW:
This Wallet remains in perfect like-new condition. I have had it for over 90 days and I like it so much that I had come come by and update my review some more.

The quality of the leather this wallet is made of is incredibly good. The color has remained on the wallet as if it were the first day. the wallet, despite of me abusing it has remained brand new. Great to carry all the stuff you need for your daily life. I am a New Yorker and I like to carry as little as possible.

This is perfect for my subway card, my debit card, two credit cards, my employer ID and my drivers license on one of the special compartments.
I also carry some cash. I'm not a cash guy so I usually carry about $20 worth of change consisting of: 1 $10 bill, 1 $5 bill and 5 $1 bills this wallet, as compact as it is, has room for more but that is all I need to carry and it fits it well.

This wallet is super light weight and so thin that you can berely notice that I have a wallet on my front pocket... No more wallet in the back pocket for this guy.

Quick heads up and take note of this. If you are planning to go out and get drunk... really drunk, I recommend leaving this baby at home and carry something else. I used to carry my old Military ID card and during a drunken night of fun, I got stopped by the police and while trying to take my DL out of the wallet, because of the zipper and the alcohol, everything fell out and that resulted on me losing my old army ID card... which sucked because that was a nice thing to carry and show people. There is nothing wrong with the wallet, it was my fault for being drunk, but as advice to anyone planning to purchase this wallet, leave it home with your car when you go out for drinks.

I stay a strong fan of this product and I would reccomend to anyone. I am looking into getting the more premium water resistant one. Smart investment you'll be making.

____________________________________________________________________________________

ORIGINAL REVIEW:

This is the perfect wallet for a man and I'm constantly swimming in compliments about it.
It gets 5 Stars because it has everything that you would expect in a wallet. Its amazingly compact. There's enough room for everything you need on this thing. The leather seems good quality and very durable. It is also stylish.

I would definitely recommend it if you're looking for something small, Stylish, reliable, good quality, easily accessible and that will make your friends both men and women jelouse of you.

Wanted to replace a slim leather wallet I've had for over 10 years. Discovered this little Bellroy. Like the fact that it is small and thin. I have 11 credit/reward cards inside, along with a few business cards. Zipper means your cards never fall out. Zipper is smooth opening and closing. Leather is super soft. Easily fits in your front pocket. Well designed product.

I love this wallet. But the blue color I chose not so much. It reminds me of the interior color of the '93 Dodge Caravan I was chouffered around in as a kid. But other than that, it holds an amazing amount of cards and a decent amount of tri-folded cash. Oh, and it fits in the front or back pocket of my skinny jeans without looking like I'm packing a kilo of coke.
This was a present for my mom. She loves it and, my wife loves hers. They are indestructible- high quality craftsmanship!!
This wallet is great for front pockets, It is perfect if you need to carry a lot of credit cards but don't want the bulk.
This is an awesome wallet!  I can carry 12 cards and cash and it fits in my front pocket.  It's nice and compact. IMF you're looking for a truly easy to carry small wallet, this is it.

As advertised it's very small, however you will be surprised how much it can hold. Nice leather and seems like it has a strong zipper but time will tell. I wish that the zipper went around the entire wallet allowing you to open it up completely which would certainly give you easier access to your items. This design makes it difficult to pull your cards out especially if you pack it full like I do.  This "wallet" is basically a small "credit card sized" pouch, nothing more. However, I like it because it is exactly what I was looking for. The real negative that led me to rate it only three stars is that I personally feel that this "wallet" is way over priced for what it is.
$65 95 for a coin purse ..it is a toy..worth may be .50 cents..dont waste your money and time..this is not a WALLET..i sent it back...
summary: this is an expensive coin purse

reviewText: Bellroy has a hit! Not only is the leather luxurious, they have carefully designed the measurements to be the absolute minimum size for credit cards and cash folded in thirds.  The tangs on the zipper are carefully covered so as not to allow dust or dampness into the wallet, but also protect the interior of your pocket from snagging.  I've used this for a few weeks now and absolutely love it.  It takes getting used to finding the right card, or folding bills into thirds, but after a short time I've found it second nature.  No regrets.

I can't belief how badly this item is advertised.  70 bucks for a change purse at best.  This item shouldn't cost more than 50 cents.  It is not a wallet!!!! it is the size of a SMALL change purse and I mean SMALL change purse. I would not even recommend this to my worse enemy.  This is the second wallet I ordered through Amazon. NO MORE!!!!! I recommend you be very careful ordering anything of this nature from AMAZON.

I had been on a quest for a better wallet for a very long time prior to buying this one.

My requirements are simple: I carry a few cards and a couple of banknotes, hate coins, and a wallet has to be as unnoticeable as possible or I better leave it at home and just put the cards and banknotes in my pocket. I only need a wallet to hold the cards and notes together.

It's the first wallet that I've been carrying with me all the time and haven't ever left at home so far. It's very small, it looks good and the fact that it's closed with a zipper is great, as I always know that whatever I put inside stays inside, safe and dry.

This is the one, people.  It comfortably holds 12 cards (I have 8 in the bigger pocket and 4 in the main area) as well as receipts in the smaller pocket.  It is high quality and I love the weather resistant zipper.  Does it kind of look like a change purse?  Yup.  But I love it all the same.
summary: Finally Found the Wallet I Need!  Love It!

reviewText:
I had stopped carrying a wallet approximately 25 years ago.  I carry my license and credit cards in a plastic case in the car which often ends up still in the car when I'm in the store and need my cards.

I've been on an extensive search for some time and stumbled across this small gem.  Its a little on the expensive side but is exactly as described and precisely what I needed.  From the outside, it doesn't look like it will hold much but boy was I fooled and so will every one else who may have bad intentions.

I thought that I would just carry 3 cards and some cash but I have been able to include all of my (13) various cards, license, and bills.  They fit just fine without bulking it to the point that I forget it's in my front pocket.

Very well made and looks great!

Well I had high hopes for this tiny wallet. But it comes with no instructions about how to use the inside pockets. One smaller pocket which I assume is for the folded bills had a un-sewn tab which looked out of place to me. On the other side there was a larger pocket which I assume was for the cards. I tried 6 cards and it was a bit tight with the six cards. I have another 7 cards which I tried in the center section without a pocket and the whole wallet was tight to close then. I am going to return it and go back to my shark clip which can hold 13-14 cards split into two groups some in the front and some in the back along with the bills
summary: A item this expensive should come with instructions.

reviewText: I bought this for my father who was looking for something to put his rosary in instead of just putting it directly in his pocket.  It will work great for that, however I'm sure the cross and the words will eventually wear off.  Probably sooner than I had hoped, but for the price I can replace this for him if necessary.
well made product .
A little small but easy to carry in your pocket
What can I say? It works.
just what I was looking for
Very good
It's very tiny, smells bad in a chemical way, and the zipper broke the first day of use.
summary: smells bad in a chemical way

reviewText: Arrived promptly and we are pleased with the product.
Love it.
I have bought better ones.

My mother protects her Rosary with this zippered case.
I would like to buy more in other colors in the future.

Thank you

Rosalba Fajardo
summary: I bough it for my mother

reviewText: I was looking for a minimalist wallet; something for a few credit cards, a couple IDs, a little cash and maybe a receipt or two.  This wallet is perfect for that.  And I like not having to worry about things falling out.  Quality and finish seem pretty good, but better be for the stiff price.  From a value standpoint, this wallet is probably overpriced, but I'll often trade a few more dollars for a quality product.
It's excellent, small and elegant. But I gave 4 stars because I didn't receive in an excellent shape, I could guess that some used before.
The zipper was not fully functional and at first touch the wallet felt really cheap. For $60 you'd expect much more. I sent it back,

I like a small slim wallet and this design looked great in theory. I have cut my card stash down to seven with a few very thin card-sized items, but for me the issue was that it was too difficult to fold banknotes (bills) into thirds and stuff them into the side cash pocket. The cash pocket is soft fabric and it yields when you try to insert more than a few bills. Two hands were needed to get the money in. That was a concern because fumbling and hesitating when putting money away is not a good idea.

I tried flipping the recommended directions using the center section for cash, but the side cash pocket is a few millimeters too small for cards, making it tricky to close the zipper. What a shame because it looks and feels great. If only that cash pocket had been stiff leather instead of thin fabric.

Because it was such a lovely item I will try the Bellroy Slim Sleeve, but I will seek it out in a store so I don't waste shipping etc.
summary: Beautiful and a great idea, but I returned mine.

reviewText: I've been through 2,123,455 wallets. I'm stopping here. Great product!

This is a great wallet for someone who is working toward a minimalist carry wallet but maybe isn't quite there yet.  It is a very slim wallet but will still accept quite a number of cards and folded bills.  Gonna take some real discipline to get down to as minimal as I want to be and this wallet will help me along the way.  The leather is nice and zipper is sturdy.  The zipper will pop if you overstuff it too much (a sure sign) but it's easy enough to get it back on track.
summary: Great wallet for the minimalist wanna-be

reviewText:
My review will be minimal and sleek, like the wallet.

Nicely weighted, with a good feel in the palm of your hand.
Easily holds the 8 or so cards I carry, plus cash, a few business cards, and a receipt or two.
Well made- exactly as one would hope for the price.
My new favorite.

Will be adding more Bellroy items to my collection in the future.
This is the best wallet I've ever owned! Easily fits  in your front pocket, plenty of room and the zipper holds all of your credit cards and cash securely in place. Highly recommend!
summary: This is the best wallet I've ever owned

reviewText: Too small to be useful and way over priced.
Product is great. Made of very nice materials  Will recommend to others
One of the best things I have brought for myself.  I would recommend every man get one of these.  Very soft and fits all my cards which is about 10 various cards.
I love it!, I think later I will buy the elements version.

My favorite wallet ever. I was just looking for something like this, something i'd not have to put in my back pocket which is uncomfortable.. this one easily fits in your front pockets, or the pocket of your jacket.. definitely a 5 star for me.
I love this wallet so small yet holds so much
great product
Not sure how I was living without this before.
I'm very happy with this purchase.  I had a giant wallet prior to this.  It takes a little getting used to tri-folding your bills, but once you get used to that, it's no big deal.
This is the only wallet of its kind that I could find. Well constructed. I almost choked when considring how much it cost, but now that I have it I am very, very, very pleased.
Love it
It's a bit expensive, but holds a bunch of cards in a small space. Slides easily in my pocket.
Simply too small to replace regular wallet. Way overpriced too.
summary: Simply too small / Not replacement for regular wallet.

reviewText:
At first, I wasn't sure if I could live with the zipper, but then I thought - "how can I not live with the zipper?"  The zipper just makes sense, especially when dealing with a very small and slim wallet. There's no bulk here to keep the cards firmly pressed against my body.

Did it look a little feminine at first? Perhaps, but so do ankle high boots, and they have zippers. Bottomline, I love this wallet, the zipper  firmly holds my cards and money in place, and I'm man enough to say that I'm proud to own this wallet. I've only had this wallet for two weeks, but right now I can say that it's the best one I've owned.

Finally, I like it better than my old Koyono Slimmy wallet. Which was an excellent wallet - very durable - but whose design allowed for my cards to occasionally fly all over the place. http://www.amazon.com/Slimmy-Wallet-Original-Black-10001/dp/B005CIX54S
summary: I love this wallet, the zipper firmly holds my cards/money in place, and I'm man enough to say that I'm proud to own it.

reviewText:
Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a compact wallet, also forces you to carry only what you need.

A bit pricey but as with anything, you get what you pay for.
The best front pocket wallet I have ever had!
It is small..but perfect for me. Love it totally! Bellroy makes the best wallets ever and I have several that I have given as gifts and everyone loves them.
excelent

This wallet has excellent construction and looks great. I am impressed at how much fits inside, yet it remains thin and comfortable to sit on. I have 9 cards and a few bills and cheques inside. reviewText: I have a nasty habit of falling asleep with my glasses on, and other times they simply slide off my nose. Either way they wind up on the floor or under me - neither of which is good for the glass frame. The Peeper Keepers keep the glasses from falling any farther than my chest, and neither can they swing underneath me. Glass frame saved. From other reviews I've read, the ability of the retainer strap to stay on the glasses is an issue. These do not suffer from that problem. They stay in place wherever you put them; yes, sliding them in place takes a little bit of effort, but they don't move either. And the material they're made from is comfortable enough against the skin. A good, basic product that is well made and works as intended; at Amazon's price for a three pack, its a bargain as well.
summary: A Comfortable Way To Keep Glasses In Place

reviewText: It's incredibly small and light, yet it does everything that I need. I REALLY like it!

I have been through five different wallets looking for something that would work for me. I wanted something durable, that could stand up to sweat and abuse, something lightweight and thin -- because I hate sitting on a brick -- and simply something that could keep all of my bank cards, loyalty cards, insurance cards, cash, receipts, licenses, identification cards, EMS IDs, and fire certs organized. And it had to look professional enough to be able to pull it out and not get weird looks in a formal atmosphere (Tyvek paper wallet is out). This does all of that for me. I currently have 17 cards in there, all at about 1/2 inch thick. I've had this for about six months now, and I expect I'll not need a replacement for a year or two. I highly recommend this product if you need to carry a lot of stuff, but don't want to feel like you are.
I love it! Best wallet I've ever had.

The nylon wallet is exactly as described - very light, thin, and seems to be 100% durable nylon material.
The wallet actually seems very small, but fits US currency with a little room to spare.
If you carry lots of cards, this isn't the wallet for you.
The wallet has a license window and two other card pockets.  Each pocket will easily hold two cards and will still allow the cards to be easily removed when needed (three may fit, but it would be tight).
There is a divider in the currency area, so another card or two could be be hidden in the back of this area if not used for currency or notes.
One note of caution - if you're a habitual wallet checker (that is, you regularly reach back to be sure your wallet is still in your back pocket), it make take a while to realize that you haven't lost your wallet - it's just much smaller and thinner that you remember it!

reviewText:
I like the "Inside ID" Wallet, but not as much as Allett SoftTech Nylon "Sport" Wallet. The "Inside ID" wallet is definitely the classier looking of the two and has the ID frame inside the wallet, but most places that ask for IDs always want you to remove the ID, so I'm not sure it's really a timesaver having the ID frame.

The "Inside ID" allows you to spread out your cards into 3 or 4 different slots, whereas the "Sport" has only two slots. However, I carry anywhere from 14 to 16 cards and both wallets offer me enough room to carry that many cards AND enough cash without issue.

I like the "Sport" Wallet better because I like a more compact wallet. The "Sport" version fits into almost every pocket I would want to use it, while the "Inside ID" wallet is more of a standard wallet size.

I'll definitely use both. The "Inside ID" wallet will be used for special occasions, when I want something that looks a little classier. However, the "Sport" version will be my everyday wallet.

I love the quality of both though and am happy I have both.
summary: A great, inexpensive slim style and sporty wallet

reviewText: My husband has been using this for over a year now and he loves it. It's super thin, which was his main concern. It's also not just plain black or brown, which was his specific request. But it's worth noting that unless you have a lot in it, it doesn't hold grip on one or two cards very well. The nylon material is very flexible and not a very tight fit in the card slots. My husband still loves it though, for the slim profile. It has also not worn out in any areas.

So far, so good. It's small and compact, feels good in the hand. The online photos didn't indicate how many credit card slots the wallet has; there are three slots plus the inside ID window slot. Consequently the wallet can fill up quickly. If you are not a minimalist, you might be disappointed. The wallet feels durable, but time will tell.
summary: so good. It's small and compact

reviewText: It's thin and looks fine, however cards do not fit snuggly in the card holders. When I pull the wallet out cards are partially out of the holders. Interior sleeve materials need more friction. It's unfortunate as the wallet seems decent in other aspects but this is a huge flaw.

Small, and light weight. Goes good with jeans.

When i received this wallet, i got what i expected. A light weight super slim wallet.
But there were some negatives, the product is nylon. So you cannot iron it because it will melt. The problem was, the wallet hand wrinkles/fold marks, also when laying the wallet down on flat surface, it would pop up open half way, on top of that the alignment of the wallet was not perfect.. That really disappointed me, so i tried to do something about it. This is what i did.

I took everything out of my wallet, then i put the wrinkles/folds on top of the steam coming from my kettle, what it does is it softens up the materiel, you can rub the wrinkled area with your finger if you want, but it won't help to much. Just don't hold it under the steam to long or it will start melting. After that i wiped away any drops in the wallet and let it dry for a little. Then i took the wallet and aligned it to its proper place and what i did was overnight put a bunch of texts books over it, and a 10 lb weight on top of them all. i woke up and the wallet wouldn't open when laying on flat surfaces, the wrinkles were gone, and the wallet became just what i wanted. But i recommend when you put text books on your wallet, keep all of your stuff IN your wallet, so it may form its alignment to your cards/money. Also try sitting on your wallet, in your back pocket. It also helps a bit. just make sure when you sit on it, that its aligned properly in your pocket.

Everything that is advertised, shipped quickly (free shipping option), very well put together, not a single complaint! Finally, a wallet that is super thin and will slightly bend due to the material being flexible, no more odd shaped or uncomfortable pocket issues!!!

reviewText: I had a thin profile wallet from another brand for about 8 years & it was finally time to replace it. After doing a bit of research, I settled on this one. After a month of use, I've been very happy with it so far. It seems durable & will hopefully last a long time. It is well constructed & fits all my stuff no problem. I have 7 plastic cards, about 10 business cards, various receipts & cash in it & it holds all of it. So far, so good. If I have any issues, I'll post updates, but I don't foresee any issues. I recommend it.

I purchased this wallet for traveling around Southeast Asia, and it didn't let me down. Fit perfectly in my front pocket, and it's SO THIN! Had no problem fitting all the foreign currency I put in it. I love that fact that it has a divider in the billfold area. Perfect for separating currency, or keeping receipts or tickets. My only complaint is I feel like the wallet loosened up over the last 4 months and doesn't perfectly keep my cards in place, unless I have two cards in each pocket. I like the design on the nylon, but now that I'm back in the US, I'm thinking about buying the Allett leather wallet for every day use. Great Product!
summary: Perfect for Traveling, and Keeping in your Front Pocket!

reviewText: Great walet I were basketball shorts or sweat pants the Allet is small and light works great for front pocket carry.
