reviewText: Well made. As promoted, it is very slim and light. Not sure yet as to how it will wear over time. The only improvement I would have hoped for would have been to have the inside center seam of the card holders left open so additional, seldom-used cards could be inserted underneath. I also wonder if it would really hold all the cards they claim (in photos) -- but it will hold alot.

Fantastic! Ultra thin, flexible and performs the task.  I jam mine full with credit and bank cards (5), gift cards (2), drivers license, various IDs (5) coupons (varies), important papers (POLST) a few newspaper clippings (hey I'm old and still "read" the paper and almost forgot about $60 and no back/butt pain.

Nice wallet - made in USA! Would be a little better possibly if the slots were rubberized to hold in cards for added security. None of mine have fallen out, but still it would make me feel better.  Very easy to use, nice quality, small footprint, holds a lot.  I think it is a great choice and a wonderful product. Please keep making them in USA - I'll keep buying them!
Great for gym use.
This is a great wallet. I was given one as a Christmas gift about 5 years ago. I just purchased a new one. Leather wallets never last 5 years for me.
summary: This is a great wallet. I was given one as a Christmas ...

reviewText: Slim as promised! My old leather, magnetic money clip was finally on its last legs and as much as I liked its character, I felt like it was destroying my credit cards and exposing my cash contents. This came up searching for a non-leather slim wallet. It's very slim, holds a surprising amount and seems durable. It might be a little too casual for more formal settings, but perhaps the leather one would solve that.
This is the greatest wallet ever if you don't want your bottom to hurt everyday. You will not notice it is there but it is made of quality Nylon.
summary: This is the greatest wallet ever if you don't want your bottom to ...

reviewText: Just as thin as they say in the ad.  I have been looking for a thin wallet and this is it.  Holds everything my thick leather wallet did at a quarter of the thickness. After years of thick wallets I sometimes forget I have the wallet in my back pocket and panic I forgot my wallet.
Great wallet!  Lightweight, efficient and wide enough for Japanese Yen too.
My husband LOVES this wallet and ordered another as a backup.

Works as advertised.
Could have been a bit bigger.
I've been buying wallets from All-ett for probably 7 years. Third wallet from them, great quality and cool color!
Very thin

Very lightweight...very. I would like a compartment that opened laterally instead of from the top (all pockets open "upward"). I like a sideways pocket behind the ID for items. Construction and materials are great. Only time will determine if it holds up, but I expect it will.
Awesome, small thin and efficient. Better than leather. Would buy again. I may look for a smaller version for short trips (going to dinner).

reviewText: I read the reviews about how light it was, but even after that, I was still unprepared for how light and flexible it was, such that it seemed flimsy. However, after transferring my cards and cash, it was exactly as I imagined it to be. I absolutely love how light and small it is, especially how it can fit in my front pockets, and everyone knows how notoriously small women's pockets are! It is very very thin--it is thinner with all my stuff in it than my last wallet empty. The only concern I have is that my cards might slide out. It hasn't really been much of a problem yet (I've used it for two months now), but I did catch a few times when my cards were not fully inserted. Other than that, this wallet is great for anyone looking for a convenient, unobtrusive wallet. The color (at least the blue one) is exactly as pictured. Awesome product!

I received the blue one yesterday, color was a good match to picture here.  I am glad I trusted the reviews, extremely light weight and I could barely feel it in my pocket.  My cards fit well in the slots.  This should be a keeper !
summary: color was a good match to picture here

reviewText: Works well but the plastic window inside developed a hole after about three months.
as advertised

Have gotten a lot of positive comments. Quick delivery. Will get more for Christmas
presents. Super-lite and durable

It's a very nice, compact, flexible wallet. The leather is soft and you barely notice it in your pocket. If you're looking for a firm structured wallet this isn't for you. One minor gripe I have is that the ID slot is a tad short, making the top of your ID visible as a white stripe. A bit unsightly. This may be intentional to make it easier to pull your ID out and to prevent it from getting stuck. Regardless, it's a good wallet at a good price.

I only gave it four stars because I Find my cards sliding out of the pockets very easily and I could leave a card behind or drop one without noticing it because there isn't any pressure holding them in.  This also happens when I have 3 - 4 cards in the same slot.  Other than that, I really like this wallet.
summary: ... Find my cards sliding out of the pockets very easily and I could leave a card behind or drop ...

reviewText: Beautiful black leather wallet.  It was exactly what I was looking for: thin and carries all my cards/cash.  It won't perform the miracle of taking an inch thick wallet and reducing it down to nearly nothing, but it does carry quite a big and does so in as minimal a package possible and very stylishly.  Definitely recommend.

I fit 14 ID or credit cards in the wallet as advertised and even some cash which I usually kept in my pocket.  It still had room for a few miscellaneous business cards, etc. and still was easily half the size of my previous wallet.
summary: Does what it says it will do!

reviewText:
Nice thin leather on the outside with thin nylon on the inside makes for a good slim wallet.

I've used it for 3 months now with zero sign of wear. It's so thin that the leather looked flat and almost cheap when brand new, but after a couple weeks in my back pocket the leather molded around the contents enough to give it a good solid look and feel.

Does what it says, contains credit cards and ID in a very compact package. I double stacked a few cards in the available pockets and have had no problems. Leather outside feels good. Very nice wallet.
Very thin and great product.

I like having a slim wallet. My dad's is an inch and a half thick, my cousin's is an inch thick. That's a pain in the butt, literally.

There's 2 money/cash chambers, so you can keep your 100's, 50's, and 20's, separate from your 10's, 5's, and 1's. Or put checks in one. Whatever, there's 2 separate money-holding areas where you'd expect them to be.

There's an ID slot, so you can put your ID in there, and show it to bartenders or whomever easily.

There's not a lot of room for storage of cards, so you've got to be smart about what cards you keep in there - credit/debit card is good, CostCo card is neccesary for those that shop at costco, Sam's club card same deal, medical insurance card, and there's room for a few more. Most places that offer 'membership perks' like grocery stores, REI, etc, you can just give or type in your phone number, and so you stick all those cards in a drawer some place never to be seen again.

If for some reason feel that you NEED those cards, or store business cards in your wallet, this is probably not the thing for you.

Previously I had the original Allett made of sail cloth, and it was starting to get worn. I like leather better, even though it's slightly thicker, and the leather version holds less cards than the sail sloth one did.
summary: If you don't want a thick wallet, this is it.

reviewText: Love this wallet, I hate to carry bulky wallets and this one is great
Small, slim and holds all I need to carry. Very impressed.

He actually liked it! I was not to sure at all when received. It is much smaller then standard wallet. Cleaned out current wallet. Everything left fit in easily. After a couple days asked how it was working out and his response was "great". Also said it was so much more comfortable sitting at desk and in car with out the extra bulk. Wanted and searching for RFID wallet but that was my fault for not remembering that random items are thrown into an Amazon search!

You will not believe how thin and durable this wallet is.  I purchased my first one of these wallets 3 years ago for our teenage son who wanted to upgrade from his little kid velcro wallet.  He loved the soft leather and thinness.  No bulk in his back pocket.  My husband couldn't believe how well it held up being so thin.  After three years of seeing what a great wallet this is for our son, my husband finally asked for his own.  I bought a second one for my husband who now also uses it every day.  Highly recommend.

Chintzy, nothing like the "first editions" of the Allet line -- which could hold over 20 cards and remain the thinnest on the market.  The new ones are smaller and lighter; but far less usable.  I'll probably continue to use my "old faithful" Allett, though it's seen better days, and keep the new one for the rare occasions when I need to carry only a few cards and licenses.  Very nice, if you didn't really need a wallet.
summary: I'd hoped for both new AND improved - and just got new, with less functionality.

reviewText:
So far, so good. I replaced my big skinny wallet with this one and I am happy with it. I wanted a leather looking wallet because I was tired of the material of the big skinny. This wallet provides an elegant look of leather, while maintaining a slim form factor.

The only negative I have is that the card holder slots are a bit loose. I notice my cards slide around at times. This could also be the fact that I only keep one card in each slot to keep it thin. I don't really carry that many cards, so that could be the reason for the loose fitting slots. I didn't knock off a star for this however because the good of the wallet outweighs this issue.
summary: so good. I replaced my big skinny wallet with this ...

reviewText: This wallet was a great buy. It was very slim and could easily fit a few cards without causing any bulk. I would definitely reccomend this product if you're looking for a slim wallet.
Slimmest wallet I've had

I love ALL-ETT's - I do.  Every time I buy one, and every time I use it, people say, "where did you get that?"  It is SO much better than a conventional wallet, and it REALLY DOES work - I have no idea how they do it.  I can pack just as much in it, and it's nearly HALF the size of my old "regular" wallet - it's absolutely amazing.
Now the caveat - this particular model was different from the last two I ordered.  It had "one fewer pocket" on each side for credit cards, and I'm puzzled as to why.  I know it's not the "larger size" wallet I got the 2nd time - but I kept both of them - and the first "pocket-sized" All-ett I bought DID have 3 slots for credit cards!  So - it's not that I can't fit as many cards in it - I CAN - but, it's just not as "convenient" to have only two slots for credit cards, ID's, etc.  Thus - only 4 stars this time, folks - but it's still much, much better than anything else I've ever had, as a wallet!!!
summary: ALL IN for ALL-ETT - but one flaw...

reviewText: Good product

I was so excited when this wallet got delivered as my old one had finally fallen apart. My old wallet lasted my entire life (I'm 23 years old), and I had a tough time coping with the fact that I had to find a new one.

Here comes this thin wallet on Amazon, and my initial thoughts was that I was very impressed. I was looking for a practical slim thin good looking wallet and so far, this one has fit the bill. Currently, I put about 7 cards in the wallet and it feels so much thinner than my old one! The exterior is made of a nice quality leather and the interior is made of some unique nylon hybrid.

It's a bifold wallet with an ID card holder. It also has two spots for cash in case you need to separate bills or receipts. I love the way it fits in my pocket, and also how it has no gaudy logos. It does have an "A" logo on the outside but it's barely noticeable

Overall, I've been very very satisfied with my purchase especially considering the price I paid (initially I was looking at the $80 bellroy wallets). Only thing I hope is that it lasts another 23 years like my old wallet!
summary: Excellent wallet based on my initial thoughts!

reviewText: Best walet out there. I love it!

PROS:

-Solid construction.

CONS:

-Items slide around way to easily on the inside pouches. Not a problem if you only have cash, but will be an issue if you're like me, and like to sneak in a plastic bottle opener and a key or 2.

-At full capacity, a bit tough to close, especially if loose items in main pouch begin to slide around.

-Not exactly cheap for such a minimalist wallet.
summary: A minimalist concept that does not execute well for folks with existing bulky wallets.

reviewText: Epic enough said

Nice and slim, almost half the size of my old tri-fold with the same stuff inside.  Appears to be well made. Interior nylon like material is attractive and suits the black leather nicely. Only time will tell as far as durability. But so far it's a nice piece and I'd buy it again. Recommended.
Too soon to tell. It seems pretty good.

For years, my hubby was searching for a thin wallet.  One day, he saw his brother whip out the "perfect" wallet...thin and sturdy.  It was the Allett. So, my hubby purchased his first one that was made out of material rather than leather.  He had the Allett for years and was extremely happy with it.  But, alas, it eventually fell apart.

Being a professional, he needed a more "professional" looking wallet, so I bought him the leather Allett for Christmas.  Quite frankly, I was a little scared because I didn't know how a leather wallet could be "thin" and was concerned by hubby wouldn't be happy with it.  However, upon opening it and now having used it for 2 months....he loves his leather Allett.  It fits comfortably in his pocket, is well made and sturdy.

My husband carries 2 credit cards, his driver's license, cash and an ATM card.  I don't know how much the Allett can hold, but for my husband, it works perfectly.

This is a great wallet. My old wallet was a big lump in my pocket. I put everything from my old wallet into the Allett ID wallet and it is less than half the size. I forget it's even in my pocket. Highly recommended.

After using the full nylon wallet for a while, I felt that I just wanted a leather wallet again. This is not as thin as the full nylon, but feels a lot more solid and slightly more cushy. It's worth the price, although beware of the ID window. The adhesive on the inside of the window can squish over to the card, which may be an issue for some. It's very minor, but worth noting.

All in all, a great wallet that doesn't bloat up.
summary: Great wallet with a minor caveat.

reviewText: My husband's old wallet was falling apart and was almost 2 inches thick!  He carries his wallet in his front pocket, also, and it was always a challenge to retrieve.  He loves this wallet!  It holds a lot but it's so thin.

The idea behind this wallet is great, but while its design does minimize the volume of a traditional, fully packed  wallet, I found it more difficult to use. With all my cards packed together, I couldn't easily or quickly retrieve the card I needed. And ironically, the wallet's lack of heft and volume made it feel less substantial and reassuring to carry. Some may like its simplicity. I found it lacking.

reviewText: Love it

This is my new favorite. I got this and retired my leather big skinny sport. I had ordered another big skinny and sent it back as the stitching and quality went way down since my original purchase. Thats too bad. Now for the good news. In comes Allett to save the day. Nice stitching and leather. The only thing I would change is have the corners slightly rounded as that is the first thing that will wear if that is not done. That aside its a great wallet. I put two cards in each of the slots and then hung it upside down and shook it. Nothing came out. Not even the cash. Made in USA as it should be. Comes in nice box with cardboard wrapper that says "End Wallet Butt" then that is sealed in loose plastic. Nice presentation.
Great product.

reviewText:
I have had the nylon version of the Allett Inside ID wallet for quite some time and it has held up great! So one day; I decided that I wanted something a little more classy and business looking, yet still thin.

So I decided to give the leather version a try. On the outside... all class (at least I think so); but on the inside, it is still has its nylon-ish super thin glory.

The leather has held up great, so far. I had it in my back pocket, squished between my buttocks and a uncomfortable chair for hours at work, on the way to work, after work, even at the strip club where it was squished between my booty, a strangely comfortable chair plus a girl on top, for a very intense stress test. Which, the wallet came out unscathed and even thinner with the money inside now gone. Very impressive!
Love it! Only problem is that cards tend to stick to the clear panel inside.

They worked SO well that he grabbed another pack to put on all his slicker dress shoes. They seem to be extending the life of the shoe bottoms, which saves getting them re-soled sooner, but also just give some nice grip no matter where you use them. He writes for a men's fashion blog and has a YouTube channel and has since recommended these profusely! After a couple months in all kinds of weather, they've stayed secure and helped provide some grip.
The obvious: make sure to clean the sole of the shoe, even if they're new since some may have some type of coating and because any debris, dust, etc could cause these to peel or lift at the edges prematurely. Ours were placed on fairly new and well-used shoes and have stayed very secure, even after traipsing through snow, ice and water!

reviewText: Genuinely sad to send this back. It's absolutely perfect as a single ring or right hand ring, but if you want to wear it with a band, the setting is not high enough to fit. The cut of the asscher stone in this ring is far superior to all other Amazon Collection rings I tried and the overall ring has a quality feel far above the others. The style is simple, elegant, and well done. Sometimes with costume jewelery I worry about settings. Each stone is set straight and well, a detail often overlooked in asscher costume jewelery. Perfect setting here, which adds to it's "believability". I was hoping to find a ring I could wear with my wedding band, I'm so in love with it, I might keep it anyway... It also has pretty decent weight, so you even feel good wearing it. I also included a photo of this ring next to the Amazon Collection 2 ct solitaire and you can see how much better the cut of this stone is. The sizing is a little roomy, if you're in between sizes, you can comfortably size-down. Those that complain about asscher looking like glass, that's just the nature of the cut, though this one truly glimmers. I might have talked myself into keeping it. Amazon Collection is boxed beautifully!
summary: Super Quality, totally authentic look. Classic and Beautiful!

Like most of the reviews - this purchase was a replacement for a lost asscher engagement ring. It arrived so much quicker then I expected and that was a plus.  Ordered on the 8th, told to expect on the 12th, arrived on the 10th..... very happy.  A little skeptical since this was a less expensive choice that I was considering,  I was nervous - I opened the package and pulled out the little black box inside, Took a breath, and opened that to reveal the inner black presentation box. After a minute I opened the presentation box to reveal the ring.  It is VERY pretty - not too big and certainly something that will gather the compliments.  it sparkles in low and direct light as much as any asscher cut would - Not having as many facets as a round or similarly cut stone, asscher's sparkle but aren't pretentious about it.  Which is exactly why I loved my original ring and this one is a very close copy.  Did I mention not having to pay another 5k for a ring - and this one is half a ct bigger than my original, YIPPEE.  Happy all around and so glad that this is the one I purchased. If you are on the fence about which ring to get, get this one. This is a beautiful ring and the recipient will be very happy.

I bought this ring on a lightning deal, so I think it was a fair price. The CZ's around the center stone sometimes look weird to me, fake - and other times they sparkle brightly. This ring is an absolute knock-out in the sun. I stare at it well longer than I should. Yes, you can tell it's not a real diamond, that doesn't take away from its beauty. I feel the ring is true to size. It came in a lovely box, and with Swarovski certificate. I'm really really happy with this ring.

reviewText: Just what I needed
Standard issue
nice and sturdy wallet

So I'll preface this by saying I am very weird and picky.

I wanted a bifold for my bills. But I liked how my trifold held my cards. Since they go in long ways, there's enough of the card sticking out that you can get a good enough press with your finger to slide them out, you don't have to pinch the edge of the card to get it out. Most bifolds I tried/saw, had the cards barely sticking out by a sliver that you have to pinch to get them out. This wallet has the card stick out enough that if I put it in upside-down, the raised letters of my name stick out, and thus act as a grip so I can slide the card out. Much easier to me.

The outside slot has the removable card holder, which I don't use. But if I keep the removable part in, I can put a card in the outer slot of the wallet between the card holder and the outside of the wallet (the slot between the logo and where it says "Pidengbao" in the first picture), and it will be tight enough to not fall out, but I can easily access that card. I can even take a card in/out of that slot with it still in my back pocket.

Now, I only have 2 regular house key-sized keys. I just stuck them halfway into one of the card slots of my previous wallet to store it (as a keychain for 2 small keys is just silly). No other reviews seemed to mention the 2 key holder slots in the picture. Well they work perfect for storing my two small keys that I have. I love this aspect specifically.

The only downside is of course the wallet itself is pretty thick.  I had to cut back on the cards I carry around, which isn't a big deal to me. I've got it at a size that will fit in my pocket easy enough and it is holding 6 cards, plus an ID, 2 keys, and of course some cash.

If you want just a regular wallet to hold a bunch of credit cards then look elsewhere. If you like to wear skinny jeans, look elswhere. But if you prefer to slide your cards out rather than pinch, or if you only like to carry only a few cards around, or if you need to store a key or two in your wallet, then give this a try. For the price, it's hard to beat.
summary: I can't believe I love this wallet so much.

This rose-gold-plated sterling silver Swarovski-Zirconia tennis bracelet arrived in an attractive gift-worthy box.  The bracelet is 7.25" which was a good size for my wife's wrist.  The bracelet attaches with a tongue and safety clasp so it won't become detached easily.  The stones are brilliant and really sparkle and reflect light.  My wife and I were very impressed with the quality of the Swarovski crystals.  The rose gold also stands out on this bracelet.  In other words, you can tell this bracelet is rose gold and it matches her other rose gold jewelry.

My wife was very happy when I gave this to her and she has gotten positive comments on it. I would recommend it.

It is eye-catching and no one can tell it's not made of diamonds. The stones are not huge, so it's not something people would suspect is fake. I would never pay those inordinate prices for a piece of jewelry that can be lost or damaged. This was cheap and looks just as nice.

reviewText: The cubic zirconia stones are pretty but the setting has these cheesy looking bows on the side profile of the setting that keep this ring from looking believable. The bows are in most of the pics. The profile is high, but that's not the deal killer--it's the weird bows that ruin this ring and make it less classy looking. Top view is acceptable though for the price. I lost my real 2 cttw 5 stone VS2 diamond and platinum engagement ring/band from Costco (~$5k) in the shuffle around my wedding day and I do have to say that this cz ring has great sparkle and a shiny setting which is comparable to my lost ring... and it is relatively believable from what I remember of my genuine 5-stone diamond ring. Maybe at most the cz stones in this ring are a little too sparkly, but I can't really tell and to be honest I used to stare at my real diamond engagement band all the time. For now, it'll do for the price when I just want to wear something sparkly. I've purchased multiple different Amazon Collection cz ring designs and this one is my least favorite due to the bows.

reviewText:
When I was a little girl, my grandmother had a ring that looked just like this. It was made of real diamonds and my grandfather had given it to her. My own engagement ring was made from my my mother's engagement ring and exactly what I wanted, but that other ring was always in the back of my mind. My mom (though she loved the ring) had to let go of the real ring when we had an emergency vet bill in the late 1990s, and now I've found this one! There's a reason I'm telling you this.

I am between an eight and a nine on my left ring finger (I have a set of ring "sizers" at home) so I originally ordered a nine. It was WAY too big. It kept falling off my finger. I COULD have worn it on a different finger, but I wanted something for my ring finger on days when my actual engagement ring is too tight. (I've gained some weight, so what?!)

I liked this ring so much that I gave the size nine ring to my mom and ordered another in an eight for myself.  The nine fits her perfectly. The eight fits my ring finger perfectly though my ring finger measures 8.5.  I'm very happy.  It is still a little loose and I'm happy with that. It feels more like an 8.75.

I felt both rings for loose stones and found that all were VERY secure on both rings. I worked in the yard with no gloves and mine became very dirty but was able to be cleaned easily.

My mom was THRILLED when she saw the ring I gave her! At first she thought it was Memaw's original ring! It looks so lovely and almost like it could be from any era. The stones aren't so large that they seem fakey, but they are a nice size. I'm think my engagement ring might be jealous!
summary: Beautiful! Runs about half a size big.

Anyway, I love my ring and people always compliment me on it.

Anyway, check this out! See the attached picture. One of these rings is my real ring, and the other is this zirconia ring from Amazon. Can you tell which is which??

Wearing it, the amazon one is lighter on my finger but other than that, I can barely tell a difference!  I wear my real ring 24/7 and know it like the back of my hand  (no pun intended). This is so close that it is shocking!

It just arrived a few minutes ago so I haven't worn it yet so I don't know how durable it will be and if it will keep looking this good or not.

I also bought the 5 stone (approximately 1.5 carat) band that is almost identical to mine except mine has 6 stones. I'm not gonna post a pic or review for it but it looks as good as my real one. So...in Paris,  I'll be sporting my rings without fear of losing them or them being stolen!

reviewText:
First of all, I do like this ring a lot!  It's a beautiful and pretty believable ring with clear, well faceted, and radiant stones. The three stars are for the durability of it.  I've worn it, maybe two times, and today when I reached into a cooler at the grocery store, I caught it on the shelf above it. I noticed right away that the center stone was gone and, amazingly, found it at the bottom of the cooler!  I brought it home and tried to place it back in it's setting with some of my jewelry tools but I don't know how long it will stay.  I'm afraid to wear it now, so it will sit in my jewelry cabinet.

I sure wish this was made better.  I can't recommend it, really, unless you never do anything when you wear it, or just like looking at it in it's box.  Thankfully, I bought it on a lightning deal and didn't have a lot invested. Sad!

I really wanted to like this bracelet. Yes, it looks GREAT. The clarity and cut of swarovski crystals is fantastic, and Amazon did a great job and procuring a bracelet that was well built. All gems are centered properly, links are clean (a little rough in terms of fluidity in the chain though). There's no ugly glue, off-centering, different sized/clarity gems on this.

Two things:

1) The bracelet arrives in two plastic bags inside of a manila envelope. So make sure you get a box to go with it. There's also a tag that says "MADE IN CHINA" along with the Swarovski certification tag. So make sure you remove that. Nothing says "I love you.. kind of" than a big "MADE IN CHINA" tag still on a piece of jewelry.

2) THE CLASP! What people are saying is true. This is a hit and miss. If you're not doing much and you wear short sleeves or a dress, you should not have significant issues/risks of losing the bracelet. If you're wearing a sweater or jacket or something that is porous, this bracelet WILL catch the fabric and flip open one of the clasps within a few minutes of merely walking and swinging your arms. We knew the risk and tested the bracelet out when it first arrived. One clasp opened quickly. Merely putting your hand down on the table with the release lever facing down was enough to disengage the bracelet when both clasps were missing. Upon further inspection, the diamonds on top of the clasp itself seem weird, since they're not aligned with the rest of the bracelet. A watch style clasp with just a smooth locking mechanism would have been MUCH better in comparison.

So yes. This is a great piece. But it's not for every day use, which is why ultimately we decided to return it. If you know you won't wear it with sleeves, your risk of it catching are greatly reduced (warning: it can catch on the seams of your pants). It looks great, expensive, but the high risk of it falling and being lost forever are too great to justify keeping it.

This set of 8 headbands are truly darling! I ordered the flower design, which is four paisley prints and four flower prints. They arrive already tied and a knot ready to slide onto your child or baby's head. I am extremely impressed at their soft, gentle stretchy-ness that allows them to easily fit my (petite) 6 year old daughter's head, as well as my 10 month old baby! Not too tight on the 6 year old, and not too loose for the 10 month old baby! My favorite part is the flexibility of tying them how ever tight or loose you please for the best fit. They are well made, and the stitching seems to be sewn well and firm! I just love how the pretty colors of the flower and paisley prints will add lots of life and cheer to any outfit, and add such a darling look on your sweet daughter. I honestly like them so well that I'm considering buying another set so my girls can be matching at the same time even! I purchased this set of headband wraps at a deep discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.
summary: Adorable and sweet flower & paisley prints! Fits great on both my 6 year old and 10 month old daughter's heads!

reviewText: Soft, stretchy, washable! I originally bought these for my then 8 month old daughter. They originally fit, but were not as snug as I was used to for "baby" headbands. However, my 3 year old immediately fell in love with them! They are stretchy enough for her to put on easily herself and she loves all the different patterns. My younger daughter is now 12 months old and they seem to fit her better at this age. They have held up well. I am constantly throwing them in the washer and dryer on normal settings and they don't seem to be "fuzzy" or anything. Another thing is that the bow actually comes off. At first, I thought this was kind of annoying that the actual bow could be pulled off but my 3 year old actually likes the bow sometimes and other times she wants it without. I'm happy we bought these headbands and am actually considering buying them in a different color/patterns. However, I bought these thinking they were "baby" headbands because of the little baby wearing them in product pictures. They are more like "toddler" or "little girl" headbands and if you buy them with that in mind they are great for the price!
summary: Great headbands, but more for toddlers!

Headbands are great for little girls.  I especially liked them for my babies early on when their hair was so short.  People always used to comment on how cute my little boys were, even though my girls were in dresses with their ears pierced.  Once I started putting headbands on them the boy comments were few and far between.  I own all different sorts of headbands and I have to say that I really like these.  They are a lightweight material that has a bit of stretch to it.  They remind me of a soft t-shirt.  They are about 3 in width across the back and tie in a knot in the front.  The colors are very vibrant and bold.  Size wise they are a bit bigger, I would say 6month-2T.  They fit the 7 month old in my picture very well.  They are easy to get on and off of the baby and she didn't seem to mind wearing them.  The knotted ties are a little longer than other similar style headbands so just watch how you position them.  Overall I am pleased with these headbands.  The solid colors will coordinate with many outfits and size wise you can use them for a good amount of time.

I was sent these to offer an honest assessment, and I have to say I don't like them. They look cheap, especially the knot/wire on top. It's as if someone took some material, strung in a piece of thin wire at one end and then fashioned a knot on top. Tacky looking. Also, a few of the bands in the package didn't stretch at all, but a few did. The material is a soft cotton, but I would never buy these for a baby or let them wear them. I'll be tossing these. Perhaps this company makes a nicer hairband than these, but personally, I think these should head back to the drawing board for redesign.

reviewText: These are a great price at $2 per headband. They are a very soft, comfortable material - Some people here describe the quality of the material as poor/thin and being only a step above pantyhose material, but I would disagree with this statement and thought the material was thick enough and durable, and yes they will be an elasticy material like pantyhose in order to stay on your baby's head. The 0-12 month size fit my 8 month old well, not too tight nor too loose, and she has a normal-sized head. I personally decided to return these, though, because 1.) my daughter kept taking it off immediately, and 2.) they didn't look very good on her since she has close to no hair, so without hair as a contrast I felt the look of these wide bands overpowered/dwarfed her face. All in all, this is the type of product that will work great with some babies and less great with others, but it's not a bad product.
summary: Great for some babies, less great for other babies

reviewText: Lasted less than a week on my 11 year old daughter under normal wear--to school and back. Cute, but not durable.

Purchased: Black, Beige & Fuschia. The beige was first-it is super soft and has gold yarn intertwined-very cute & classy. I then ordered the black and now the fuschia and we are very happy. The black has silver yarn and the fuschia has fuschia metallic yarn.  The flowers are great-perfect amount of bling so its not obnoxious but still fun. They fit my kids as well as myself so I'm not sure why people crab about them being small. Maybe they have larger than average heads(?) Anyways, I've hand washed them & used liquid fabric softener to make them smell really fresh & feel softer-not that they weren't rough to begin with or have a bad odor- I just prefer to wash them first. Plan to order four more colors for my kids and as more gifts as necessary. Gave it 5 because they are decent quality for the price, warm, unique and very cute. You cant just run to the store and find these-we get lots of compliments! This is a great alternative to a hats for us adults for sure and great for kids on those days where it isn't a hundred below zero when they don't want a hat on AND they feel cute as a princess in them! I wish there was a lime green and purple for two of my girls who love these colors.
summary: Love! Purchased three now-plan to buy more!

reviewText: I bought this to use as my wedding band. It has been 3 months and I am still in love with this ring! It looks like brand new, shiny gold, with no scratches or dull areas. The best part is that no one knows that my gorgeous wedding band was purchased for under $20 on Amazon and not for hundreds of dollars at a jewelry store!

I got this to wear as a wedding band while I'm pregnant, and while I can tell the difference between it and my solid gold real wedding band, when you consider the huge price disparity between them it's hard to fault this ring! It has a nice gold sheen, and it's very simple and classy and comfortable. If you're trying to save money on a wedding band I would definitely consider this, I'm not sure it's worth paying more when you can get something this nice looking at this price!

A Review of Lucky Love Knitted Leg Warmers With Lace Trim (Cream)
http://www.amazon.com/Knitted-Warmers-Lace-Trim-Cream/dp/B00G874L22/ref=sr_1_4?s=apparel&ie=UTF8&qid=1446529551&sr=1-4&nodeID=7141123011

When I received these elegant and snow white leg warmers, I opened the package, which held a charming message, to find my very own pair of Knitted Leg Warmers. As my first pair, I was delighted at the sight of them and immediately wore them on my next occasion going out and about. The buttons are both beautiful and chocolate brown! The knitting is superb and the lace exquisite! The fit was so snug and so perfect! It's been such a pleasure to slip them on when going out the door and enjoy them as a new accessory has been added to my wardrobe. I recommend this product for its ever present beauty, its artistic qualities and its affordability.

I had and have had a wonderful experience with this pair of Knitted Leg Warmers with Lace Trim. From the superb quality to the elegance of its design to its excellent price point, the question of if I would recommend is a definite yes.
summary: My Review of Lucky Love Knitted Leg Warmers

These glasses are comfortable, fit well, and just the ticket for us older riders who don't wear glasses full time, but need reading glasses.  The bifocal sits low enough on the lens that it doesn't interfere with riding, depth perception, etc., yet gauges and indicators are easily seen in perfect focus.  The "gasket" around the eye cups is durable, yet comfortable.  It seals out wind adequately, yet allows enough air flow to help fight against fogging in colder weather.  I've used mine for several months, and would replace them immediately with another of the same if they were to ever break or become lost.
summary: Great Glasses for Riders Who Need a Little "Help" Seeing Up Close.

reviewText: I recently purchased this ring to wear to work.  As a nurse, I have to use alcohol based hand sanitizer dozens of times per day and it was causing a build-up in my wedding set, so I wanted to get a simple band to wear to work in its stead/ to wear while traveling.  I had previously purchased another tungsten ring (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004RRZFPW/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc=1) and, while I liked its versatility and width I wanted something lower profile because that band sits rather high.  This band is perfect in every way.  The thickness of this ring is approximately half of the linked tungsten ring.  I also love that the white tungsten color more closely matches silver/platinum, although I do like the gunmetal color of regular tungsten.  This ring can be worn interchangeably with my other wedding rings, which are platinum.  I highly recommend this ring.
summary: Perfect, true to size, color is very similar to platinum (see pictures)

reviewText: This is a very high quality and attractive ring. I especially like the high polish and durability. It is twice as strong and double the density of steel which is why it is the most resistant metal to scratching. It is extremely hard, ranking about 9 on the Mohs scale (10 is the highest such as diamond). It has a nice weight to it and the comfort fit shape feels great on my finger. Even though the cost is very inexpensive compared to platinum, it is superior in scratch resistance and the color is very close to that of platinum to where it is hard to tell the difference. It feels strange to spend so little on such a high quality wedding band set for my wife and I. You usually get what you pay for - not in this case. Anyway, I highly recommend this ring!
summary: If you like the look of platinum with superior scratch resistance, this ring is the one.

I've had tungsten carbide rings for years, because I didn't like how dull my silver wedding band would look after being scratched and banged around for a few weeks. But the old tungsten was never quite bright enough. This new WHITE Tungsten is amazing. It looks like platinum and is very resistant to scratching. I've also gone thinner. My old rings were in the 6-8mm range and you could really feel the weight. My wife is a nurse and moved to a very thin band for work, so I am following suit. I tried a 3mm and a 4mm - The 4mm is perfect for me. Bright and shiny to catch the light and light enough so it's not a pain to wear all the time. MJ had the sizes and widths I needed and delivered quickly via Prime. I'll buy again when we need more.
summary: White Tungsten is the way to go.

reviewText:
I got the MJ 5mm white domed tungsten ring...attached a few photos...the ring is on the wedding finger below the other two which are both 8mm tungsten carbide, one has brushed portions and the other is 100% shiny.  The pinky ring is 100% stainless steel.  The middle and index fingers have 8mm tungsten carbide and wood mixes.

The white tungsten may look close to stainless steel but in person the white tungsten more closely resembles White Gold.  You can see the hue of the nickel in the stainless steel in person, and the other two rings on the wedding finger look much darker in comparison, and even though I really like the shiny one a lot, its gray when compared to white tungsten.

I also feel that 5mm is a perfect size.  It just says wedding ring to me.

WARNING! WARNING! WARNING!
A lot of the one or two-star reviews say the ring breaks easily. They don't understand the difference between strength and hardness. This ring is incredibly hard, meaning it is almost impossible to scratch, but it is very brittle because there is no "give" in the material. It will not dent or bend like a gold/silver/platinum ring, it will shatter because of its hardness.

DO NOT BUY if you expect this ring to withstand drops. handle it very carefully while it is not on your finger. And if you do break it by dropping it, buy a new one, they are CHEAP compared to anything similar in white gold/platinum. You WILL NOT find another material that can look brand new after a decade of use like tungsten carbide can.

Added bonus: this ring is easier to remove from your hand in an emergency and much less likely to stay on your finger if smashed, unlike gold/platinum
summary: Know what you are buying. hard =/= strong

I have worn the ring every single day for three years, I've changed tires, installed windows, dug holes, and about every kind of abuse you could issue and it's still perfect and has exceeded every expectation. One thing that you may not be aware of is that it's heavy for the size - it's about as heavy as gold, but I like the feel.

It does not turn your finger green. It's super durable and one of the best purchase choices I've made.

Arrived quickly and looks as advertised. I was very happy with it until after six months of wearing 3 days/week the ring cracked/chipped. I work in healthcare and am not doing any rough work (hammering, using power tools, carrying heavy loads, etc.). I am not hard on my rings at all.

Requested a replacement from the seller who said cracking of tungsten rings is normal and to Google it (???) and if I sent a photo they would replace. Sent the attached photo months ago and no replacement was provided. You can see the chip and crack - the dark line through the middle of the ring.

Avoid this seller and get your ring from someone more reputable.

I would recommend them for anyone that does a lot of heavy work with their hands (my real wedding set sits in the safe because grew tired of paying for prong replacements and the jeweler asking "what are you doing?!?!" when they had to re-bend the bands to a circle shape) as they hold up well.

reviewText:
My fiance and I got a set of these (3 mm for me, 5mm for him) during our engagement and absolutely love them. We worried the reviews were too good to be true, but for the price, we figured they'd be a worthwhile experiment. And they definitely were!
I use mine as a substitute for my wedding ring while at work. I work in a science lab and was tired of taking my wedding ring on and off to put on lab gloves. This ring is extremely comfortable (easy to forget I'm even wearing it!) and gloves easily fit over top of it. It's also really durable. While the white gold of my wedding ring is already showing some scuffing and dints from gentle use, I keep this ring on almost all the time at work and it still looks brand new.
As for my fiance's ring, I figured he'd also want to use his as a "work ring" and I've offered to buy him a "real ring" of some kind of precious metal. But he loves this one so much, he doesn't want anything else.
So, whether you use these rings as an alternate to your "real ring" or use them as your main ring, you will be happy with your purchase!
summary: Gorgeous and durable: would have paid $100 for this ring and still consider it a steal!

Too shiny

Using it as my wedding ring since early June.  After 3+ months I've had no skin irritation or other complaints.

The size is true to other "10" rings I've tried on.  With a few exceptions the ring is on my finger 24/7, including showering, and has been knocked against other metals or other things that I'd expect to scratch softer metals, it's still as shiny as the day I put it on, no scratches.

One thing to consider, as a friend reminded me, is that unlike gold these harder metals cannot be easily cut off your finger if you're injured... I work on my car and other mechanical stuff quite a lot--For all rings, but especially ones made of harder metals: Removing the ring before you do anything where you might injure the finger is a good idea, as is getting it off the finger ASAP if you do injure yourself.
summary: Using it as my wedding ring since early June.  After 3+ months I've had no skin irritation or other complaints.

reviewText: Beautiful ring for an awesome price! I'm a size 4, and although this ring is comfort fit, it is true to size. I can see it holding up to kayaking, traveling, household chores, etc. My job requires me to wear gloves. As you can imagine, the engagement ring tends to get caught (not to mention is not sterile), so I'm forced to take off my engagement ring each time I don a new pair of gloves. I plan on reserving wearing the engagement ring for going out, and I don't plan on taking this ring off after we get married. The description says nickel is used as a binder, so hopefully there are no allergy issues. We'll see how it holds up, but so far it seems very nice and good quality.

reviewText: Nice ring!

APPEARANCE:  In terms of color, this piece very closely resembles white gold. It is only a half shade or so darker in hue, but this is only noticeable in a side-by-side comparison. In reality, no one will know this isn't white gold. The ring looks and feels substantial and expensive. (NOTE: if you want the "white gold" look, be sure to buy WHITE tungsten, not regular tungsten. Regular tungsten is a darker gray.)

COMFORT: Looks and wears like a true comfort fit with smooth, rounded edges.

DURABILITY: Two and a half months after our wedding, there is not a single scratch on this ring, even when viewed under magnification. It looks absolutely brand new. Despite the fact that tungsten is naturally more brittle than gold alloy and other metals used in jewelry-making, so far the ring has stood up to what I would consider an above average level of wear and tear without breaking.

PRICE: Ridiculously affordable. Just under $18 as opposed to $300-400+ for good quality white gold (that scratches and needs polishing once a year)? A no-brainer. Plus, you get to skip the worries that accompany wearing an expensive piece of jewelry. If you ever lost this ring, replacing it would be a breeze. Eighteen bucks and two Prime shipping days later, voila! Brand new ring, negligible damage to your wallet.

WOULD I BUY AGAIN? Without hesitation. We couldn't be happier with this purchase.

reviewText:
Love this ring, love white tungsten carbide! If you are looking for a workhorse of a wedding band, white tungsten carbide is the way to go.

My husband has wore 2 consecutive gold bands to paper thin nothingness. This ring in the 4mm has been great for him; he works in maintenance.

I've had a 6mm from MJ Metals since 2014 and wear it almost everyday. I work part time as a florist and love gardening, so that ring has been through some rough times and it still looks fabulous. I need my bifocals to see any wear.

I wanted to try a wider band, so of course reordered from MJ Metals. I love it. My sister tried it on and said her pinky finger started to fall asleep after wearing it for a few hours. She doesn't have that problem wearing the 6mm. Maybe that's why the 8mm is more of a men's size. The other difference between the 6mm and 8mm is the edge of the ring. The 6mm has a thicker edge than the 8mm. Both are comfort fit and domed. My guess is the 8mm dome would be uncomfortably thick to taper to the edge thickness I'm used to on the 6mm. Again, after 3 years, I love my 6mm white tungsten carbide.

The only other fyi is on the color. It does have a dark under tone next to sterling and white gold even though it has a mirror shine like chrome. So, the color may bother someone looking to wear an engagement ring on the same finger as this ring.
summary: White Tungsten Carbide is a beautiful workhorse of a wedding band

The only down side is that this ring will not bend or break, so if you mess up your ring finger then you will have to go to the emergency room to get this ring removed. For the price, this ring is amazing!

It is beautiful, better in person. My husband likes big bulky rings but they make is fingers look chunky, which is why I ordered this ring for him. It looks really good and fits his finger really well. Thank you!

This ring is incredible! It keeps its shine and no one even knows it is white tungsten. The only downside to the ring is that it is quite heavy compared to white gold. Your finger adjusts to the weight after a while, so please don't let that discourage you from buying this. I would definitely buy this product again. I've had it for a few months now and I never take it off! There is no wear and tear or discoloring on the ring.

My husband lost his wedding ring putting in new landscaping in our backyard, he's been determined to find the ring and said to just get a temporary ring until he finds his actual wedding ring. Great quality ring for it's price. We wear this as an everyday ring, while we keep more the valuable wedding bands safe from scuffs etc. I usually have an allergy with most jewelry but this ring seems to not cause any reactions.

UPDATE: I have had this ring for almost 4 months now, not a scratch! Still looks as shiny as the day it was delivered. I have dropped it a couple times onto ceramic tile and expected it to shatter like some reviews I read, but it just bounced! I love this ring and would recommend to everyone I know.

In my case this was bad guidance, having said that, the company in question answered all of my questions and is willing to take the ring back for a full refund.  I have subsequently ordered another ring in my size because I can and must say the quality is great.  As for the return of my first ring I have not decided yet, I may keep it just in case my finger gets bigger.  Additionally, once I get the new ring if it fits well I may order a gold plated one in addition to the one I have.  Good company, great ring.  I recommend you order you exact size regardless of the width of the ring.
summary: Great product, questionable sizing guidance by AMAZON

reviewText: Love the ring,  looks just like white gold. I've had it for a year and looks like new. These rings run true to size.

I misplaced my 5mm Platinum wedding band somewhere in my house right before a business trip to Las Vegas.  Yeah, the wife didn't buy it either, but it happened.

After not being able to locate my band for a month, I decided to pick up this ring as a stand-in until my band surfaces.  Looks just like my Platinum band with one exception - this band isn't scratched to heck.  :)  Platinum looks great when new, but within a month it develops micro-scratches that make it look dull and cheap, requiring professional polishing to restore it, which I have done a grand total of one time in the last ten years.

I really do hope to find my Platinum band at some point, but even if I do, it will just go in a drawer for safe keeping.  This ring looks far better and is very comfortable.  The only significant difference I notice is the weight - my Platinum band is far heavier.  Platinum is also extremely strong while I understand this ring is not, but I doubt that issue will surface...and even if it does, I liked the ring so much that I bought I second one as a backup for my backup.
summary: Looks just like my Platinum wedding band

reviewText:
I bought this ring to replace my gold wedding ring, which I'd managed to lose (fortunately it turned up later.) Not so fortunately I ordered the wrong size and my new replacement ring was way to big for my ringer. I would have immediately lost it too. I notified Amazon right away that I wanted to return the ring. In a day or two I heard back from MJ Metals Jewelry that they wanted to make the return as easy for me as possible and would be happy to exchange the ring for one of the proper size as soon as I could manage to return it.

I mailed the oversized ring to the seller and only a few days later received a replacement ring that fits perfectly. It was a pleasure to deal with both Amazon and this seller. The ring itself is extremely good looking and has a comfort contour which makes it much more pleasant to wear than a ring that has the more usual sharply carved edges. Since my gold ring happily turned up again, I now wear BOTH of them simultaneously on my ring finger which actually makes a striking looking combination.
summary: A beautiful ring and great service

reviewText: I have a really bad habit of losing rings (plus I don't like how a lot of rings hang on things), but sometimes you just wanna signal to the world, "Hey, I'm taken, back off!" Haha. This ring was nicely packaged, came quick, fit perfectly, and looks great. I wish it were a shade daintier, but overall a great buy that I'm very happy with. Super comfortable and great price -- so if I lose it, I won't lose sleep over it. (I still think of the beautiful diamond wedding band I lost way too many nights before I fall asleep...)
summary: Excellent buy, tough, attractive, and comfortable

reviewText: Looks like platinum and it's very durable.  You really can't tell it's not expensive at all. I bought two for my husband so he can wear whenever he's finger get swollen or shrunk.  Most of all is super comfortable to wear.

Update: I ordered a second ring, size 5.5 this time, to wear as a ring guard for my slightly-too-big engagement ring. Now I wear the size 6 band shown here, stacked behind my engagement ring where it belongs, then the 5.5 on the outside to snug everything into place. It works great as a fitting fix, and because this band is so fine and understated, it doesn't look too heavy even though I'm now wearing three rings on my wedding finger. Very satisfied.

One thing to note is that the interior is convexed so it's a little tighter than actual size. For example I'm a 12.5 but on a ring sized it's a smig smaller. Also one thing to note that in the light it is truly bright white but low light is a gray white.

Other than that not much more I can say, it will do its job until I figure out what my final ring will be and after that this will be something I wear when I travel.

**This product was a personal purchase for myself at the normal retail price. I am reviewing it solely because I want to share my experience with other potential customers. I have received no compensation for my review nor do I have any relationship with the seller or manufacturer of this product.
Great for being in the sun

If you want a hat that you chase all over the place, this is the hat for you. The slightest puff of wind blows it off my head. It was delivered on time, packaged appropriately, but this hat is absolute junk, a total waste of money purchasing it, and also a total waste of energy having it delivered. It is leaving a trail of portions of fragile hat straw everywhere it goes and there are already a couple of places on the brim that have fractured enough for me to put two or three fingers through. The straw is incredibly brittle.  The vinyl padding that is in the inside of the front brim is useless, it should have some ability to soak in some sweat, but it just flops down and needs to be pushed up repeatedly. And don't even get me started on the chinstrap. It's about as useful as a cat-flap on a surfboard. The adjuster has no friction so you can't lock it under your chin without a knot in it. I've finally put a second strap on it to go around the back of my head to stop it blowing away every time I step off my tractor. It won't be very long before it is tossed into the incinerator.

I got this in extra small, and it doesn't feel too tight. The dress is really flowy, light, and comfortable, and I love it. I'm 5'0" to 5'1" depending on who measures me, so the long hem goes to the ground for me, but I've come to terms with maxi dresses and their hems. The color is actually more vibrant than in the picture, and don't worry about the dress being see through because there's a white shift underneath that goes to about the knees.

It's a shame, though, that this dress came with a rip at the seams on top where the shirring is. It was small, but since it's at the seams, it'll just get bigger if any pulling happens [which actually happened when I tugged on one of the shoulder straps to take the dress off]. I spoke with the company, and they offered me a 40% compensation if I could get it repaired by someone else. I paid about $7 for this, so I'm getting about $3 back, but getting it repaired would be a bit more if I want it done correctly by a tailor. I'm just going to stitch it up myself and hope nobody notices.

So if you do purchase this, just keep in mind that it's a hit or miss, especially when it's this cheap. If this dress came to me 100% intact, I would have loved this dress.

All of that being said, it is really beautiful with that unique color combination.  And it is somehow still pretty flattering despite my desire for a longer bodice.  I also had some issues with static in the skirt part, but I think that had more to do with the weather (and my lack of a de-static-ing spray, or even hairspray, which most women probably have).  Overall it was probably one of the best buys I've made through Allegra in terms of it fitting like the picture and looking like a much pricier dress than it actually was.  I feel a little bad purchasing things like this, but...I'm not well-off.  Someday, I'll buy local, when I have a normal income.  :)  In the meantime - thank you, Allegra K!

reviewText: 5'5"; 140 lbs; 38" bust, 26" waist, and 40" hip. I bought the size 8/10 dress and it fits perfectly! I absolutely love the dress on me. It is very fitted just like most of the reviews have said and it shows all the best curves. The length on me comes just below the knee which I love. The dress is very fitted so its not very forgiving for undergarments so I would just plan to go without (flower petals might come in handy). I read a lot of complaints about the sleeves but they seem fine to me.. they are more like a t-shirt fit as opposed to capped sleeve but they are still fitted. The dress by itself is already sexy but can easily be played up with a statement piece of jewelry such as a necklace or lots of bracelets and heels. Heels are a must. But other than that the dress is great!  It arrived the day it said it would (about 2 weeks later).
One word....,Sexy.....,, more on the topic...,well the sleeves are a bit too snug so if u got biggish arms like me then go with a size larger. Still, very sexy dress.
runs big and fabric is thin and unforgiving.  I ordered an medium and it was floating on my 5' 5", 135 pound frame.  I do not recommend.

This should also come with a sign that says, "Yes I'm a Tramp."  For clarification, here are my specifications: 5'10" tall / 36" bust / 25" waist / 36" hips / 140lbs (tall and slender).  The dress I ordered claimed it was size 8/10.  Lies.  Lies, my friends.  Maybe that means it requires 8/10 people to squeeze you into it, it you happen to not be Asian.  if you are Asian, or an extra small Hayden Panettiere, by all means, this might be the dress for you, if you want everyone to know that you crave attention to validate your existence.  After I shimmied into this "dress," I blushed at my own reflection, because you could see every part of my body - I'm talking lower back dimples in detail.  Where would you wear this dress?  it's not suitable for work, church, the gym, or even the clubs (not enough attention craving cleavage, mind you).  I thought it might add a subtle hint of body hugging femininity, but it was like a black plastic garbage bag had been saran wrapped all over me.  My butt was a victim of waterboarding.  My breasts were trapped in a hug I couldn't get out of.  And not in a good way.  If there is a good way.  Ultimately, if you are the size of a My Little Pony or if you are on the far end of the trashy side, buy this dress and love it.  If you're not, let yourself breathe free and pass this up.
summary: Should come with its own pimp

reviewText: Fits great, the pattern is beautiful. Super comfy.

These nursing nightgowns and matching robes are by far my favorite thing I packed in my hospital bag. I wish I had bought them for my first two babies, but the third time is the charm I guess! Theyre modest and comfortable, and its so lovely to have a pretty print to wear in the early postpartum hours and days. Im 510 and its a perfect knee length on me. I was about 180lb at 39 weeks and now about 160lb postpartum and I ordered Large. It fit when I was still pregnant and its obviously a better fit now that Im not. :) Its wonderful and easy for nursing. Both the nurses and my doctor commented how great it was for postpartum. So happy to have found them!

I don't know how anyone larger than a D cup can wear this.  On top of that, the smell of dye was so strong and the fabric felt like dyed cardboard.  I wouldnt put this on my skin or anywhere near my baby.

I just received this gown today!  Soft material, cute pattern.  Light support for comfortable sleeping and modest coverage for a mama of young boys.  I'm 8 months pregnant so I haven't used the nursing aspect of the gown, but it seems nice not to deal with snaps in the middle if the night.  Although, I'm hoping the neckline won't stretch out.
summary: Light support for comfortable sleeping and modest coverage for a mama of young ...

reviewText: I love this night gown! Its comfortable, cute, and functional. I haven't used it for nursing yet as baby won't be here for a couple of months, but Im certain itll work just as it should. Love it!
NOT A NURSING DRESS. THERE ARE NO OPENINGS, SNAPS, or ANYTHING THAT WOULD MAKE IT A NURSING GOWN.

They are as beautiful as maternity clothes get. The only thing is that I order theee different ones in X- large, and they all fit differently, one seems to be a little smaller then an X large, one fits fine and the other fots like an XX large. Im 176 lbs and 35 weeks. I use to be size medium prepregnancy. The material is comfortable.
summary: They are as beautiful as maternity clothes get

reviewText: This is not as soft as one I bought a few years ago from the same brand. It is also longer than the previous purchase and although this one is a small, it fits very similarly in width as the medium previously purchased. I am 5'2 and currently 7.5 mos pregnant (155 lbs). It is fairly easy to lower the top over the breast for breastfeeding but will have a tendency to slip back over (depending on breast size and whether your bra keeps it down when you open that up too). You need to wear a bra with it if breastfeeding since there's no pockets for pads. It may get in the way a little bit but it's good lounge-wear.
summary: Good lounge-wear, need to wear bra for nursing. Not the softest material.

reviewText: perfect fit and the cotton fabric is very soft and cool.

Im just under 5 ft tall, weighing 150 lbs in 9 month of pregnancy. Medium fit perfectly, even top area while I am 36DD. My husband surprised me with this purchase, he thought it was going to have slits for nursing, but very elastic at top to pull down, he just wanted it more discreet, so Iost a star. Its beautiful though!
Super comfy and convenient for labor and nursing! Fits as expected, and super cute patterns!

I like the quality, material, and style. Though I'm still pregnant - expecting my newborn any day now, so I haven't had a chance yet to try it out while nursing. I wanted something nice and modest to wear at the hospital - and I think I found a perfect gown for my purpose. I was a size 8-10 pre-pregnancy, so I ordered a Medium, and it fits comfortably. Though my bra size hasn't changed much - I still wear B/medium size. Very pleased with this product; hope I won't be disappointed when it comes to breastfeeding part.
summary: Perfect find for a hospital stay

reviewText: Love the color, overall fit and easy pull down at the neck portion. I feel ready to cuddle and feed baby when he arrives! Some advice I was given was to stock up on comfy "baby cuddling outfits" for those first few days and this fit the bill perfectly!!!
works very well as a nursing nightgown and very comfortable. It allows a place for your breast pads to stay in place. It can pass for a dress if you need it too as well.

reviewText: I love love this night gown.  I didn't really do gowns before now.  I was more a tee and yoga pants or athletic shorts girl.  This gown makes me feel pretty even in my third trimester of pregnancy.  I also never realized how comfortable a gown would be to sleep in.  I ordered three and plan to wear them long after I give birth.  Maybe forever and just size down as the weight comes off and breastfeeding ceases.  Best pregnancy buy to date... and this is my third pregnancy.
Very cute and comfortable. Much softer after washed.
Fits well. I wish it had an internal NRA support.
Comfy
Color
Waiting until I give birth. Beautiful pattern. Soft material.

If I could leave zero stars I would. Please don't buy this if you are looking for anything comfortable I bought this for my hospital bag for after having my baby and this nightgown came smelling like so many chemicals. The line on the dress were your boobs are sits right on your boobs. Not comfortable for someone who will be giving birth.
summary: Please don't buy this if you are looking for anything comfortable I bought this for my hospital bag for after ...

reviewText: I was drawn to this nursing gown because of the elastic collar, seems like it will be very easy to nurse in it! Turns out the elastic was slightly irritating at first, but after sleeping in it I got used to it. I think I will wear it a lot this summer and am considering buying more.
summary: seems like it will be very easy to nurse in it

reviewText: It is very bad quality
I like the color. It fits perfectly and he material is comfortable , not too hot.

Just what I was looking for... I bought this as something I could leave the hospital in comfortably and also use as a nursing nightgown. It's more of a nightgown than a dress, but it will be just fine for leaving the hospital when it's hot in June. I am 9 months pregnant now, and it still fits fairly nicely even as huge as my belly is. I already ordered another one.
So very cute and practical for mom to be! Nice fabric and pattern, and love the elastic neckline. Will make skin to skin contact so easy! Great value for the $$$.

Love it! I am so happy that I finally found a maternity nightgown that is super soft & comfy! I am 33 weeks pregnant / 170 lbs (pre-pregnancy size 12-14, 145 lbs) and ordered a Large - gown is not too tight, but not too loose either; washed and the color did not fade; its super soft; and the top will be easy to pull down to nurse my little one. This will be my 3rd c-section and I can attest that you do want to purchase a nightgown for after the surgery b/c you won't be able to bend down (to pull up your pants) after or move very well. Trust me, you'll thank me for buying this afterwards!
These are gifts and haven'y been given yet.  They are very attractive and seem to be of good quality.
summary: They are very attractive and seem to be of good quality.

reviewText: I absolutely love these for both pregnancy and breastfeeding. Theyre comfortable, breathable and pretty. I just bought more for my second pregnancy.
While this nightgown was cute and comfy, it doesn't have clip down or snap down sides, so you have to stretch out the elastic.
Easy pull down for nursing, cute print, and nice cotton material.

This is not a deal like I thought it would be. This gown is scratchy, stiff, and makes me look still pregnant. It also showed up smelling like rotten eggs and chemicals. I can get a better gown that will work for nursing at Target.

Bigger bust hack!! I was almost disappointed when I put it on and saw it was almost low cut against my 38G/H chest, but thinking of a trick Id used with other blouse/dress pieces with a similar shape, I put it on backwards! The back is shaped almost exactly like the front, with the same kind of elastic to pull down for nursing, but the neckline is significantly higher so it covers my giant chest a lot more that way. I urge any of the mamas saying its not a good fit for large chests to try this! I haven't been able to find hardly anything this comfortable that has better coverage for my size and cleavage around here is pretty frowned upon and anyone with a bigger bust size knows how much harder it is to keep cleavage under control!
summary: Hack to fit bigger chests!! 38G here!

reviewText: Received yesterday and tried on, have not washed yet and it says 100% cotton.  I am 35 weeks pregnant as of today. I ordered the medium and usually wear size 6/8....thinking it would be a little roomy.  The medium seems to fit tight as of now, was wanting to wear at the hospital but I think it might not work then.  Also has a chemically smell, hoping that will come out in the wash and it doesn't shrink any either!
I'm a happy customer. It's soft and comfy and allows me breastfeed easily.
Loved this gown I wore it at the hospital was great for breastfeeding and it worked perfect since I had a cesarean
summary: Loved this gown I wore it at the hospital was ...

reviewText: I bought my normal size medium and it is too small. I needed to go up a size. I like the look of the pj. Will buy the next size up.

The perfect gift for mothers to be. I have 3 and my son is 2 now,  I still wear them all the time! (Might I add they have held up great over the years-they are very well made). So so many compliments, the nurses even wanted to know where I got them from. In those first few weeks with your baby you can live on it (it looks like a nice spring dress). I called it my marsupial pouch for my four pound baby, I would tuck him in the bosom pouch and he would fall asleep on my bare chest. Heaven!

reviewText: No bust room whatsoever in the XL. The Empire waist line comes to the middle of my bust even with a bra on. No support. Returning was an expensive hassle so fortunately this wasn't too expensive. If you are small chested this may work for you. Lovely material. Definitely could be worn as a dress and not just a nightgown!

reviewText: I bought this to wear in the hospital when I found out I needed to have a c section. It is amazing and I wish I had more of them. The top stretches down which is great for skin-to-skin and learning how to breastfeed. It's also really comfortable and cute for when you have visitors.
Floral print happy and cute. Neckline is so simple to nurse with and maintains its Hale. Happy to not have to mess with buckles. Great for my csection delivery
Bought this for my pregnant granddaughter and she loves it.

Transitioned to this gown after using the 3-in-1 gown for labor and delivery. Very comfortable.

reviewText: I purchased this to sleep, I am not pregnant; its difficult to find nightwear with a bra type shelf. I usually wear a sports bra and a nightgown. I was hoping the material was soft and would easily slide around in bed. The material is not, it is thick, stiff, has a great bra type shelf. Also has an annoying side seam which will drive me nuts while sleeping. This is not a good choice to sleep for the finicky sleeper. A good day dress at home. Not worth the $$$.

Perfect modest length for the hospital and house guests. The top is very stretchy and pulls down with ease for nursing. I plan to purchase a few more!
summary: Perfect for during and after pregnancy!

reviewText: This was so cute, but is not really functional as a nursing gown. Elastic at neck and arms is too tight to pull down to nurse, or to extricate any mammary gland organs from the dress. And, there are no snaps. Its a nice idea, maybe for post partum formula feeding or for antepartum. Completely didn't work on me. Also, XL is far too tight around my belly. Size 18 pre-pregnancy.  I had high hopessuch pretty fabric options. However, the fabric is not all that stretch or soft.
summary: Elastic far too tight for breastfeeding access

reviewText: Wore this in recovery after my C-section in the hospital and got multiple compliments on it.  It's comfortable and the design is nice. I typically do not wear nightgowns to bed but after reading other reviews I decided to buy 2 if these gowns. I absolutely love how comfortable they are and wish I had purchased them earlier on in my pregnancy. I purchased a 2x and have room in the top still. I wear a 44DD bra.
I love the color and how it fits. Perfect!
Very cute pattern. Soft! Gave as a gift and the expectant mom was thrilled!

reviewText: Seems okay fit. As expected material quality for being foreign-made. However it came with a horrible chemical smell. Washing it seems to have helped some but it was really strange/bad that it would be sent in a plastic package that would have leeched the chemical smell into the fabric.

reviewText: Super cute and comfortable. I'm 5'10' and carrying twins in my 31st week. My pre-baby weight was 140 and I ordered a medium.  Should be perfect once these two little nuggets are out.  It fits now tightly but has good stretch.  High quality fabric, very well made.

Allbgood

reviewText: Just okay. Not the most comfortable or flattering thing.

The top is really stretchy and is great for breast feeding and doing skin to skin. Not something I would wear out of the house. But I never wear pajamas out of the house, to each their own. I highly recommend this for expectant mamas

The length is great, comes right to my knee and Im 53. The isabela pattern is so bright and cheerful and the elastic at the top makes nursing super easy!

reviewText: I wanted to love this gown, but it ran small and was super unflattering. I can see where it would be nice for nursing, as the top pulls down easily. The length was good, even at 5'10" - I felt confident that my bits wouldn't be on display if I walked around in it. Ultimately, however, I ended up returning the item in favor of a more attractive style from another company.

I bought this while I was pregnant as preparation for having a nursing nightgown ready.  It does fit around my baby bump, currently 36 weeks.  I like the print and the cotton is nice.  Nothing unsnaps for nursing, but it has stretch that allows you to pull it down to make a breast accessible.  I bought an XL which fits, I just feel the bust area is slightly small for me, I'm currently a 40D.  I'll definitely be using it and would recommend this product.

This is so cute. I should have read the description better I like the click down for nursing this is just extra stretchy elastic that you can pull down far enough to nurse but I really like it and for being tall it reaches to my knees which I like. I was concerned about the material, I didn't think it was all that soft, but once I washed it it got softer! It's really cute and covers all the right places. I'll be using for hospital and probably at home when visitors are here. My only recommendation for the company would be to use a softer material but other than that great gown.

reviewText: This gown isn't tight but I definitely wouldn't consider it a good maternity gown, just a good one for after baby bc I don't have much more room for my belly to grow and I am a size 16/XL and 6 months pregnant. However, I washed it as soon as a I got it following the instructions and it came out of the dryer with a hole on the belly. Never even got to wear it before it was messed up. So, it's definitely cheap material considering what you pay for it. This is a $10 nightgown, not worth the $29 I paid.

It's a decent night gown for nursing. Elastic scoop neckline makes it easy to pull down for easy access for breastfeeding. Quality is ok, nothing like Hot Milk night gowns but it's a pretty colorful nightgown that makes late night/ early morning bf sessions simple.

Very well made and soft material, bought to bring to the hospital for after delivery but will be great for wearing around the house once baby gets here in October. The length is perfect and fit was true to size. (I'm 5'9", size 16-18 and ordered an XL) Plan to order more!
