reviewText: Hmmmmmm. Seemed like a great one. But I actually don't like the right elastic right below the breasts. It's extremely uncomfortable and binding for me - especially when breasts can be sore and tender from breastfeeding. Also, it definitely runs small.
Finally a more comfortable night of sleep!  I kept putting off maternity sleepwear, but now in my third trimester, I needed to feel like I wasn't just squeezing into my pajamas. These fit the bill!

reviewText: Love this. Ordered this for use in hospital. Found it way more comfortable than the hospital gowns and left me just as accessible for the doctors. The fit was a little snug postpartum.  But I wound up ordering a second one for when I was home. Predictably-the hospital one got stained.
summary: Love this-perfect for post partum healing

reviewText: Love this! Amazing print in person! Love the material! Great to nurse in

At first I purchased this dress and thought meh, didn't impress me. I also had to exchange for a larger size because it wasn't very roomy up top. (I went from small to medium- I am 128lbs, usually size 4, 34C). The material could be softer also, even after washing. HOWEVER- After I had my baby and am exclusively breastfeeding, these dresses have become a must! They are easy to pull down (the collar is elastic in order to do so) when I need to whip out a boob, for lack of a better phrase. They are comfortable and I can quickly throw one on for the day. I ended up purchasing 5 more! I use them as day dresses and not nightgowns, most of the prints work out for this and they are thick enough cotton and long enough to go out in. I wore one just after giving birth to ride to the hospital in. It photographed well and I felt "dressed" and not like I was in some yoga wear or PJ.

I will note that they are not support dresses- I wear a supportive bra underneath if Iam going out or feel the need to around the house, as the elastic under the breasts is not very tight/supportive. (To me this also is what makes it comfy so that's ok, but if you are looking for "no-bra" built-in support type dress, this is not it).

They've washed well in cold and warm water and in my dryer without shrinking. So far they are my go-to nursing dress at 3 weeks postpartum.
This is comfortable and stylish. I wear as a dress instead of a nightgown.
I love  this ring! The amber color stone is different and it does shine. Easy to wear, sometimes I forget I have it on. I have received compliments on it already.

I wanted a more modest pajama dress for wearing around visitors to the hospital and the first few weeks that was also convenient for breast feeding. Don't have the baby out yet to test the breast feeding, but the top is very easy to pull down. It has a lot of give to it.
summary: Super cute. Fabric is really comfortable and soft. Might wear it as a dress instead of pajamas!

I bought this to wear in the hospital after having my third baby. I wanted something that was comfortable, lightweight, knee-ish-length, easy to nurse in, and cute enough that I felt comfortable wearing when people came to visit. This met all the criteria. I got so many compliments on it (several even thought it was a dress that I could wear out). I wore it with a Medela nursing bra for extra support and to keep the nursing breast pads in place and that was a good combination.

Pre-pregnancy, I was about a size 6, 130 lbs, 5' 8", with a 34B cup size. At 9 months pregnant, I was about 150 lbs, 36C cup size so I wasn't sure which size to get - small or medium. I ended up choosing the medium as some of the reviews suggested ordering a size up. The medium was a good choice. I might have been fine with the small, but when everything is a bit bigger post-birth, I wanted to be comfortable and not worry about things feeling too tight.

Would recommend to any expecting mom!

I practically lived in mine the first month or so home. Yes, the bust is somewhat loose but I found that to be extremely comfortable the first week or two when your milk first comes in and you have a lot of engorgement where the support from my nursing tanks caused too much pressure making wearing them the first month or so too painful. The top was too loose to wear the nursing pads I'd purchased, but I was easily able to put in a kitchen towel or a cloth diaper insert for nighttime, which honestly caught more milk than the pads so was a better solution for me anyway. It also allowed enough room for a milk saver in the boob I wasn't nursing from, which the nursing tanks did not allow room for at the beginning. The fabric is light and kept me cool during those really hot summer months. I had purchased a couple other nursing gowns, but this was by far my favorite. Purchasing a couple of other prints in this gown now that I'm expecting another summer baby.

This far exceeded my expectations. I ended up buying 4 of them, and they're exactly what I needed for pregnancy and nursing!

I ran across these nightgowns while I was pregnant with my second kid. I knew from experience how important it was to have comfy clothing that was easy to nurse in, comfortable to sleep in, and not too revealing for receiving last minute visitors. The reviews were good so I sprung for a couple even though they were on the pricier side. They did fit according to the size chart. I wore them as nightgowns through the 8th month of pregnancy, then I packed them in the hospital bag and started wearing them around the clock after I had the baby.

The neck elastic is stretchy enough to pop a boob out quite easily, and it's manageable with only one hand and a fussy newborn since there are no fiddly clips. The elastic under the boobs means that it holds nursing pads in place (not perfectly but well enough), so I don't wake up in a puddle of milk. There's enough extra fabric in the abdomen that I was able to wear it for all except the last month of pregnancy and it was comfortable right after delivery, but not so much fabric that it will be too bulky going forward. The fabric is like a cotton t-shirt, and the elastic isn't scratchy at all.

I don't write a lot of reviews, so the fact that I'm writing this one with a newborn means it's the cat's pajamas!
summary: These are the best - totally worth the money!

reviewText: Cute and comfy! I usually wear a women's medium. This is a little tighter than I'd like but I think once baby is born it will fit well. The top is easy to pull down to breastfeed and it goes down to about my knees (in 5'4"). I might end up getting a few more as long a this one holds up well!
I expected this to be more A-line, therefore - more flattering. It fits fine, but it's not something I'm going to show off or wear in front of others.
summary: It fits fine, but it's not something I'm going to show ...

reviewText: These nightgowns were my favorite after my daughter was born, I basically lived in them for the first 3 months.  I'd had an emergency c-section so pj pants were very uncomfortable for me for several months.  The fabric was super soft, which was essential, because my skin became hyper-sensitive after birth.  And the pull-down neckline for easy nursing became my favorite style of nursing top.  So simple, so easy.  Now that I am pregnant again I'm back for more, and happy to see more patterns.  I don't really need more, the originals are still in good condition, but who can resist new prints. :)
summary: These nightgowns were my favorite after my daughter was born

reviewText: Soft, comfortable and cute.  5'4" 130 athletic build pre-pregnancy and ordered a size S.  Fits a little tight on the belly at 33 weeks, but will be great post delivery.

This is so convenient for nighttime nursing! I find it a bit too reveling on a huge nursing chest to wear at the hospital without a robe on, but for home it's perfect. It's easy to pull down the gown and feed the baby. The cotton is soft and thick, yet it is not warm. I'll buy a second one.
I get nothing but compliments when I wear this! Super sparkly and deceptively expensive looking. Love it !!

HINT: To keep your fashion jewelry in good condition, always paint it with a coat of clear nail polish before you wear it. I do this for my jewelry, and it doesn't tarnish or turn my finger green.

I have to admit the flashing starts to wear faster than expected, the rose gold isn't as discernible as my other tri-colored jewelry ~ it's starting to look like yellow gold, especially against my other rose gold pieces. I also would recommend buying a half size smaller if available. I bought this to wear on my ring finger, yet it fits my middle better, and I used a professional ring sizer.

I would sometimes throw a light jacket over it and answer the door without feeling completely exposed or super grungy.  The elastic in the first two did slowly loosen but it took months of constant wearing and feedings to cause this. I highly recommend these gowns!

Highly recommend if you are looking for something cute, comfortable, and functional.

If you're like me, the v-neck dresses are frustrating as well for nursing, because They are low cut and wearing a camisole under just complicates nursing. I also had a c-section, so it's also great because there is no pressure around my incision.

reviewText: This gown is amazing! I am 5'2" And weigh 158 pounds at 39 weeks pregnant and a 36 D bra size. I got this gown today and had to try it on immediately. It was sooo soft. I read where some women say that it could be softer, but this is perfect. It comes to my knees and the stretchy parts around the arms and neck aren't itchy or irritating. It even has more room in the bra area for bigger boobs (luckily since I'm giving birth in 5 days and I'm going to breastfeed). I can not wait to wear this at the hospital!
Love this!!very easy to pull down n breatfeed.also makes u look super thin,which is a plus especially after having a baby

I love my nursing gown. It was given to me as a gift, but I had picked it out myself. It is just what I wanted for hanging out around the house super pregnant, possibly to wear during labor/birth, and to have for nursing. If I have visitors, I will probably put on a nursing bra to be a little more modest, but I think this will suit just fine for when people visit after baby is born. Nothing hangs out, but if I had a leak or engorgement, I'd want to be wearing a bra. I shamefully realized that I had worn this almost every night to bed for 2 weeks without washing it (gross prego moment!!). So I bought another! This time I got one of the prints that they carry a matching newborn gown in... (another gross prego moment!)
summary: After I wore this to bed for like 2 weeks without washing it, I decided to buy another!

reviewText: It's very comfortable and fits as expected. Matches the picture perfectly. I'm a few days away from my due date and it fits snugly around my belly now. I much prefer the stretchy elastic-y tops that just allow you to pull them down to nurse (like on this dress) as opposed to the strappy things that you snap and un-snap. Always considered that an unnecessary complication they added to nursing clothing. Basically this dress was perfect for me!

I don't feel like I am wearing a moo-moo when I wear these they are very feminine. I plan on bringing one or two the hospital to wear instead of those dreadful hospital gowns.

I am very disappointed by this nightgown. The reviews were good, and so after looking at a number of different ones, I decided to order this one (in spite of extra mailing expense as I live overseas). When I received the nightgown, right away I noticed 4 gray-black marks and a hole in the front of it (perhaps where it was folded and tacked and then stained). Because I am due in 3 weeks and also didn't want to go to trouble/expense of mailing it back to the US, I decided to spot-treat and machine wash the nightgown in hopes that everything would come out. Nothing did. Now I am left with a dress that wasn't cheap and is damaged. I definitely would not recommend this nightgown.

reviewText: very beautiful, fits nicely.

I'm in my 5th month and (begrudgingly) acknowledged I needed to get sleep clothes because my shorts and my husband's shirts are just not fitting anymore. I am notoriously shy to spend a lot money on clothes--- I have a nursery to assemble!--- and I found it really expensive to go to stores and get a nightgown. I wanted something I could grow with and transition with after the baby. I found this for a reasonable price and it had the right blend of fabric to get me through the summer. The only thing I think could be better is that there is no built in bra component and since my chest is huge and heavy now I'm feeling like I want just a tad more support. However, this is comfy, cool, and attractive. I can also see that this will be easy to nurse with because of how the elastic lays on the neckline.
I have 4 of these nightgowns. Well, these are my daytime wear too (at home). Its that comfortable! Having them for the past 9 months, all 4 of them still good as new.
summary: Its that comfortable! Having them for the past 9 months

reviewText: My husband even commented on how cute of a "dress" this is. It's soft, comfy, very functional, and I love wearing this. (I'm 34 weeks pregnant right now, and know this will be a go-to when I'm feeling exhausted and healing and nursing post-partum.) I'm 5' and love the length for a night dress. (Knee length)
summary: Husband complimented cuteness, functional and soft

reviewText: Really like this nightgown. It fit great when pregnant and has been awesome for nursing. It runs a bit large. The size small was perfect while I was pregnant, but an extra-small would be better now. I'm 5'6" and about 135lbs at 4 weeks post-pregnancy.

I received the Celeste color in medium as a gift. After wearing it, I decided to purchase another color in a large from Baby Be Mine's website (they have some great sales on clearance items so I took advantage of that!).  The large size hasn't arrived yet so this is just based on the medium.  I plan to wear these at the hospital, and for home to sleep in or wear around the house while nursing.

The reason I went up a size is mostly for the top area. The rest of the gown below the chest fits me alright even at almost 36 weeks.  I am about 5'7'', currently 185 lb, and 38D.  The chest is snug, but not overly constraining.  It's the sleeves that get me!  I keep pulling the sides of the gown down because the elastic around the under arm sits too high and irritates my already sensitive skin. I hope that with time, the elasticity relaxes a bit and becomes more comfortable.

The fabric isn't extremely soft, but got better after just one wash. I did not put the medium size in the dryer due to fear of it shrinking and no longer fitting me.

I think these are slightly overpriced for the quality of the material and the amount of appealing patterns/colors available (more variety and darker colors would be nice!), but they are worth it if you find them on sale or are receiving them as gifts.

Perfect for the hospital! Fit nicely, was good for breastfeeding and when visitors were there. Made me feel soooo much better than the nasty hospital gowns. Didn't wear it during labor, probably would have been restrictive, but I feel like anything would have been restrictive during labor.
Love the fabric and the fit. I'm 5'0 and had my baby last week, hits me just below the knee and plenty of room for postpartum tummy. Ordering another one.
Its very pretty but it is not very soft. I washed it twice and it is still pretty stiff.
summary: Its very pretty but it is not very soft

reviewText: Baggy, not flattering. Material scratchy. Boobs falling out, no support in top of gown.

I wanted it to wear at the hospital after I give birth however I have already starting wearing it as a nightgown because it is so comfortable! The material is lightweight and has some stretch to it that fits nicely around my baby bump. I am not a small woman and this was the perfect length size (I have gained ALOT of weight with this pregnancy). I am also at a D cup at this point and have great coverage in the top. The material is slightly see through so nude undergarments are a must if you do not plan to purchase the robe as well.

I would definitely purchase this for someone else as a gift.

summary: It's nice to use at home right after the hospital as ...

reviewText:
I haven't use this yet for nursing, but the collar is super easy to pull down and seems like it would be comfy.  It has been great for lounging around in towards the end of pregnancy, as it is nice and roomy and comfy.  The fabric is a sturdy cotton that, while comfortable and totally breathable, also isn't so lightweight that it will show underwear lines or nipples through the fabric.  I can tell this is going to be a staple for me in the early weeks, and I'm debating getting a second (or maybe a third) one so I can make it through several rounds of spitup without doing laundry.
The own negative thing I can say about it is that it is not the most flattering piece of maternity wear I've found--I wouldn't really wear it out other than maybe a quick trip to the grocery store or something.  If you get a comfortable size, the cinched band in the middle won't sit right under your breasts, but instead will be an inch or so lower, which is what makes it less flattering (but also more comfortable because you don't have something squeezing you too tightly there).  You could probably sleep in this just fine if you wanted to.

The pull down design is really nice, much easier than unhooking snaps like some nursing clothing. The material seems kind of cheap and the seams were coming undone in a few places so the quality isn't that great for the price.
summary: The pull down design is really nice, much easier than unhooking snaps like some nursing ...

reviewText: Love this nursing nightgown! I already bought it in a second color.  I do think it runs large tho.  I am 5'7", 195lbs two weeks postpartum and the small fits me great. I originally purchased both the medium and the large.  The large was huge and while the medium fit when I put it on, within an hour it was stretched out and way too big. I returned both and purchased a small.  Also, beware, the different pattern/colors fit differently. The Molly and Nicole patterns have a fair amount of boob coverage, but the Estelle is so low, I felt like a porn star! I actuslly measured the different colors to compare and the Molly and Nicole patterns measure 5" in the bust from the elastic empire waist band to the top. But the Estelle pattern measured only 4" in the exact same spot.
summary: Love! But be advised different colors fit differently.

reviewText: Love these for nursing!!
nice design. i like it.

Its pretty and when unexpected people come by in the morning and I'm not dressed yet, I still feel presentable - like I'm wearing a cute dress.

reviewText:
I love the style of this nightgown - it's cute, comfortable, and modest. Plus the material is soft. I'm pregnant now, so I haven't had a chance to try it out while nursing yet. Before you order, be cautious as to what size you get. I was a size 12 pre-pregnancy, so I ordered a large. While the large fit over my pregnant belly comfortably, it was tighter on my chest (40DD) than I prefer. It wasn't unmanageable but for comfort's sake I returned the large and ordered an XL, which is much better.

Moral of the story: if you have a bigger bust, order the next size up!

A simple night dress with elastic scoop neck to allow for breast feeding.  Comes in variety of colors and prints.  Haven't delivered yet so cannot speak to functionality.  The top portion is not lined, you will need a nursing bra underneath for support and to keep beat pads in place.
summary: Pretty cute, seems they will be functional.

reviewText: Hoping this will get softer after a few washes, it's  kind of rough fabric for a nighty, especially one that a newborn will be rubbing against. I do like the fit & the elastic for easy sleepy late night feedings.
summary: Cute & comfy but a lil scratchy to start

reviewText: Soft. Fits nice
Very happy with this - may order more in other colors! I love that it doesn't show off my chest like a lot of other similar nursing nightgowns do.

reviewText: Print is cute and the cut is modest. I wanted to wear this while pregnant but the elastic waist it a little snug for my liking. I think it will be a great nightgown post-baby though, especially when company is over at my house after the birth.

reviewText: I have two of these now as they work great for night time nursing. Would recommend.

reviewText: Pretty and comfortable. Easy to pull straps down.

I am definitely going to purchase more!

I did buy another because I liked it so much, but I wish they were longer.

Great fit. Comfortable. The top is VERY stretchy so you can just pull it down to nurse. I went to full pumping after only 2 weeks so I just started to pull the straps off and around my waste to pump. I don't usually wear it as a nightgown but actually a sun dress.

Great for late in pregnancy- I was huge and this fit really well. Post partum- this is a great night gown for nursing, soft and comfortable. I wear it lots and it gets a lot of washes and just gets softer.

reviewText:
Bought another because I loved the first so much! I didn't notice much shrinkage in the wash and it's amazingly comfortable. It will be great for breastfeeding my baby once she comes!

I definitely recommend this to anyone who has acid reflux or heartburn! No pressure on your belly from these PJs, which helps me a great deal with managing my acid reflux!!

Love love love love this product!
This is a great nightgown for breastfeeding. I normally wear small/med clothes but recommend the large which is roomy without being bulky and the neckline stretches down easily for nighttime feeding.
summary: This is a great nightgown for breastfeeding

reviewText: I love this dress!! It's so soft and comfy and cute. I highly recommend it to women who are pregnant in late summer as it's very breathable and light.
Felt like I was wearing a potato sack :( I'm sticking with Belabumbum brand; it's so worth the money to feel and look fabulous!

Really comfortable maternity/nursing gown. The black and white flowered pattern is better than all the others because it doesn't show leaked breast milk. That's a big plus for me!  And it's pretty enough to wear around the house and not feel frumpy. Pulling down the neck area to expose the breast is not only easy and fast, but comfortable. When I have it pulled down, it doesn't feel like a bunch of fabric under my breast. And pulling it back up is a breeze, too. Both can easily be done one-handed.

I have some other colors, but highly recommend the two black and white versions. I purchased several. They are so comfortable, I plan on wearing them long after I'm done breastfeeding.
summary: Best and easiest breastfeeding gown I've found.

reviewText: Perfect!

It is a really cute nightgown and it fit well pregnancy and after.  Very comfy to nurse in, too.  The only problem I had with it is length.  If you are tall and looking for something with more coverage, this is not a good choice. I knew it would be shorter than it looks like on the model in the picture and I hoped it would be a little above my knees, but it is quite a bit shorter than that.  Still, I kept it.  Quality is fine and I like that it is something I could wear beyond pregnancy / nursing, too.
Great maternity night gown!  Very comfy.  The top is very stretchy and easily pulls down to breastfeed.  I plan to take one the hospital so I don't have to see visitors in my hospital gown.

Very comfortable, easy to use for night nursing.  Not that it matters, but I brought this in my hospital bag and wore it in recovery and all the nurses raved how cute it was.  It's pretty much the only thing I wear to bed now because it's my favorite nursing bedwear.

I like it a lot, but it definitely runs very large! I am 41 weeks pregnant (5'7" and 173lbs currently - size 4/sm/130lbs prepregnancy and wearing maternity Sm or M). The small fits a bit large on me even being so pregnant! I'm keeping it because it's always nice to have room, but considering this is for nursing and post-pregnancy, I could have gone with an XS.

I bought 4 of these nursing nightgowns - the 100% cotton material is very comfortable and so is the fit.  I wore this during my pregnancy and postpartum period and found the fit to be perfect - the design is especially great for nursing! It is easy to pull the strap down to nurse and pull back up - I take off one shoulder strap to nurse each side....sometimes I will leave the one strap down to remind me which side to nurse for the next feeding :)  It also looks pretty to wear at home and greet guests, as some of the designs look like a casual summer dress.  I highly recommend this product to all nursing moms - this has been a must-have item for me!
I'm not sure if this fits as nice for all sizes but as a point of reference, I was 135 pounds at term and 120 postpartum and got a Small.
Also, I found the length varies between colors - for example Lily is a few inches longer than Molly. Not sure if it was random or per design. Something to consider if length is important to you.
summary: A must-have item for nursing moms

If I hadn't bought so many things for baby I might have bought another gown in a different color for myself. I highly recommend buying yourself one. This is my absolute favorite maternity and nursing nightgown!  I purchased several nightgowns while pregnant, and this one was hands down the best.  For a nightgown, it's actually flattering as well, with elastic above your bump, without being too tight.  I actually ended up bringing it to wear in the hospital when I had my baby as well!

I normally wear a small to medium in clothing, and ordered a medium which fit great.  Now that I am not pregnant anymore I could probably have gotten away with a small, but the medium isn't overly loose and still fits comfortably.  It didn't shrink at all.

It's lightweight and cotton, but very comfortable and soft.  Many nursing nightgowns have the awkward little clips that unfasten the straps, but this nightgown easily pulls down for quick breastfeeding.  It really does make breastfeeding easy, and you don't have to worry about milk getting on the nightgown because it pulls down far enough.  It doesn't have support, so you have to wear a bra with nursing pads under it, but I just use a comfy, stretchy bra that easily pulls down with the nightgown for nursing at night, so this has not been a problem for me.

It is definitely worth the price, I would highly recommend it!

I really like a nightgown while nursing. The fit is as expected maybe a little small in the belly area (where you'd think they give a little) but for the price I probably wouldn't buy again. You can get two nursing tanks for the price of the nightgown that you can wear to bed or during the day. Comfortable-I do wear it every night

I would recommend purchasing this town.  I also love that it's 100% cotton.  The one reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that it is a bit thin.  Also the sizing was a little off.  My pregnancy size was a 6-8, with a large chest and I bought a size large. I was glad I did because it fits just right!
This nightgown is very comfortable and useful for nursing at night.

I purchased this nightgown to bring to the hospital. It fit well at 9 months pregnant and was perfect postpartum. It was much more comfortable than the hospital gowns and works well for nursing. Still have some issues with milk leaking when using the disposable pads if the top shifts, especially while sleeping. I still highly recommend.

reviewText: I loved this so much I bought a second one.  The elastic around the neckline is very giving, making it easy to nurse in, even as a large busted woman (36E post baby).  It is very comfortable and I felt modest enough in it to wear it around all the post baby visitors.  It has withstood weekly washings for the past 8 months and still looks great.  I am positive I will continue to wear this well after the baby is done nursing.

I bought this for receiving visitors at the hospital and plan to continue wearing it once we arrive home. I'm a size 0/2 pre pregnancy and have gained 35 lbs during pregnancy. The fit is good up top, but huge below the waist. I had my tailor shorten the length and will have him tailor in the sides a bit to make it more flattering after giving birth. Overall, I really like the product.  Especially the pattern! And it seems very comfortable

Not the most attractive nightgown but definitely comfortable and functional. This and a good pair of house slippers are a must for a new mom.

I got this to wear as a nursing nightgown and it fits perfectly. I was a small-medium before getting pregnant and the medium fits perfectly. I love the length. I can wear it around the house comfortably when company is here to see the baby.

I ordered a large and I was wearing a large in maternity clothes.  It was loose fitting and the fabric is so nice!  I was very comfortable laboring in this gown. The length was good too, came to about my mid thigh. It's also great to wear for breast feeding too. It's my new favorite night gown!

Fabric could be softer, length is nice and top has full coverage but pulls down easily for nursing. Large is a *little* snug around my 8 month pregnant belly, but still fits fine. It will be a great gown for after birth (bought it to take to hospital). For comparison, I am a classic large (14-16) and this is my 5th pregnancy.

reviewText: I'm in my last trimester and looking for a nightgown for the hospital since I know I'm getting a c-section.  I couldn't be happier with this purchase.  The fit is absolutely perfect all the way around.  Its big enough to fit my preggo belly without me feeling like I'm swimming in some kind of mumu.  The chest fits better than I even hoped to expect (DD's before pregnancy, currently in an E and expecting to get bigger when my milk comes in).  I can see why some women would want to wear a nursing bra underneath... it doesn't really give the same support as a nursing bra or tank, but none of the nursing nightgowns I was considering really had that feature.  I also love the length.  I'm 5'5" and it comes easily down to my knees.  I would totally recommend this.

reviewText:
I bought this for my maternity stay in the hospital after labor and delivery. I wanted something comfortable and easy to nurse in and allow the nurses to check me, but that was also appropriate to have visitors. I'm still a month away from my due date, but this seems perfect.

The gown comes down to my knees, so I don't have to worry about flashing visitors when I get in and out of bed. It's loose enough that I can easily wear it now at 8 months pregnant, which is fine with me, but I ordered a small which I was pre-pregnancy, so it runs a bit big. The neckline is easy to pull down, but my one disappointment is that it's loose around my bust, so I'll have to deal with a nursing bra as well--I was hoping it would have at least a little built in support. The cut is a bit frumpy, but the design is cute, so that offsets it some, and it's just for the hospital and possibly around the house, so high fashion isn't exactly a priority.

One side note, this thing stunk to high heaven when I opened it, so don't have any delusions of wearing it right out of the bag. If you're getting it for the hospital, order it in plenty of time to wash it!
summary: Seems great for my hospital stay after delivery

reviewText: This gown fits fine. The neckline is stretchy all the way around (has a thin elastic sewn into it), so the fit is very forgiving. There is absolutely no support in this gown, and the fabric is not sheer, but it's light weight. It almost feels like a bed sheet weight. I think that if you have very large breasts, you might have trouble with access for breastfeeding. My bra size is 35D and I have to stretch the neckline as far as it can go to breastfeed. As for the quality, the construction is fairly simple, but so far it has held up in the wash

I guessed by referring to pre-pregnancy size, the sizing would've been adjusted a bit for pregnancy and post-pregnancy sizes. This fits, but is tight around my middle; of course, I am 32 weeks pregnant. I do see it working out great after baby's born, however. The top covers nicely but stretches nice for breastfeeding, which is the ultimate goal. It is shorter than I would've expected by looking at the picture, but I'm 5'9" and used to everything being shorter, so I should've expected that.
summary: I do see it working out great after baby's born

reviewText:
I am 5'2" and a size 2. Nothing is every too short on me... except this "dress". It was horribly made and I have no idea what kind of body would comfortably fit in it.  There's no shape to it at all. The strappy part at the top doesn't lay flat (I have narrow shoulders) but the bust was very tight. The middle was like wearing a tent, and the "dress" barely came past my crotch. As you can see in the photo, it's short, but comes to her fingertips. That's not at all what I received. Like I said, this was not made for any sort of human person. Not even a child could wear this. When I requested to return it, the response I got was (copied and pasted directly from my email):

"we're so sorry to hear that you don't so like our products. Our size is Asia size, not US/UK szie, so we marked the size of every item in product page. We sent it from oversea. Without quality problem defectivewe could not pay for the shipping fee. We would like to give you 30% discount on this order , if you could not return it back. You can present it to your friends. How do you think so?"

So a 30% refund for something that was misleading. No thanks. I'll be fighting it.

reviewText:
I really do like these shoe bags for MY shoes. I have smaller shoes since I wear a 7 1/2 in women's. I can fit 1 pair of my shorter ankle sneakers that are linner in one bag which is a plus because I can use the other bag for sandals for travel. If I want to pack a larger running shoe that has a wider sole, I have to use 1 bag for each shoe so it's probably best to have a few pairs of these bags for travel depending on what kinds of shoes you want to pack. Smaller, shorter heels of mine could fit into one bag, but I would suggest putting them in seperate bags so you don't get them scuffed up. I like the feel of the bags. It's a very soft material, so it won't scratch shoe material. The top and bottom of the bag is not as soft of a material. It feels kind of like nylon or something, but I don't think it would scuff or scratch. When it comes to my husband's shoes, he has some big feet. He wears a size 12. These can fit his dress shoes when really stretched but not his tennis shoes. They don't even fit through the opening. For us, this isn't too much of a problem because when we travel, he's usually wearing those. He prefers comfort when going places, so he would be packing his dress shoes in these bags if needed. Overall, these seem like quality bags that are well constructed. The draw string is easy to use with no resistance. My only complaint is I would like to see the opening a bit bigger and the bag a bit longer. If you like to pack more than 1 extra pair of shoes, I would suggest getting an extra sets of shoe bags for whatever your needs may be.
I received this product free for my honest review. This is my opinion after receiving this product and testing this myself.
summary: Fits my smaller womens' shoes perfect. My husband's shoes are a little too big

I will definitely use these bags over and over.  You can keep your shoes looking good or packed for traveling, if you order these too.

I recently went on a long trip and purchased several different shoe bags to carry multiple pairs of shoes. In hindsight, I wish i'd ponied up a few more dollars and purchased more sets of these!

- Well made, material contains dust and dirt and easily rinses out
- Secure drawstring - keeps the bags closed (had a problem with other brands and either losing shoes or struggling with knots)
- Good size - will hold a pair of flats or sandals. For running shoes or heels, you're best only putting one in each bag.

These might cost a bit more up front, but they're worth it! Over time i'll be donating my old bags and buying more of these as replacements. They've already lasted me several trips with no signs of deterioration!

So far it's great, but 45" is the TOTAL length (for XL). I wear 42-waist pants, and just fit the final set of holes. Either the "plastic" parts are covered metal or tough plastic; I have no initial concern about this breaking.
Because its canvas, it lasts longer than its so called "leather" counterpart. ive been wanting a stronger belt of this type for quite a while and I believe ive found it. Great product.

The sizing seems to be based on the length of the canvas not the length to the holes like most belts. there is about 4.5" from the last set of holes until the end of the belt which is about right, however, that makes the length I purchased (45") more like a 41" belt.  In fact this belt is about .5 shorter than my 42" leather belt. Will have to order 2 (maybe even 3) sizes larger to fit with this belt.
summary: The sizing based on material not fit
